The player with the highest added points wins.

name: Wichtel-Rennen
description:
The small gnomes are smart friends. They jump from tree bloom to tree bloom, schmooze here and there and rest on a mushroom.
Each player tries to let their gnomes run through the woods so skillfully that their own forest plates are used and put on the table in a 5 x 5 pattern as maximum.
The winner is who returns back to the gnome house first.

name: Holiday Express
description:
Nice to look at it....the good old steam locomotive! With much noise she moves through the landscape and brings passengers to their vacation areas. We arrange a race and to give every player the chance to travel with the express.
Each player has 3 pawns and 3 secret tickets. The tickets show where the pawns have to travel with the Holiday Express. The winner is the player who reaches his destination with his pawn first.

name: Kleine Biene flieg schnell los!
description:
Each player tries to reach the beehive with his bee first. The honey bees fly from bloom to bloom. They may move in every direction. Does a bee meet another bee, this one must go back to the start and begin anew.
The bee which reaches the flying board of the beehive wins the game.

name: Lord of the Things
description:
"Amusing, easy party & family game. Collect Element stones for the Elements Fire, Water, Earth and Air. But be careful: you will find Dangers like Volcanoes, Floods, Earthquakes and Hurricanes. If you don't escape you are lost! Who will be Lord of the Things?"

Components: four game boards (earth, water, fire, air), 16 danger cards, 84 element stones (21 of each color), 4 bonus cards, and 16 player pieces (4 of each color).

http://www.printgames.net/english/detail_e/lord.htm

name: Network
description:
An abstract strategy game played on a board with sixty squares bearing numbers from 1 to 6.

"A 'spacy' party & family game. Create a whole 'NETWORK' with Satellites, Net-markers, Rockets, clever actions and a little luck... You need a DIE too!"

The object of the game is to be the first player to create a 'network' by placing satellites and your net markers.

Components: gameboard, 6 satellites, 6 rockets, 24 net markers in four different colors.

http://www.printgames.net/english/detail_e/network.htm

name: Blütenhupfer-Farbentupfer
description:
Each player takes one of the meadows. Then he takes one butterfly with 2 holes in their wings. Simultaneously all players try to find a position on the board where the color which shines through the hole is the same as on the other wing side.
The player who finds it first wins, and the next round can begin.

name: Saurus
description: The dinos are on their way to modern times. They have to overcome obstacles along the way. Hexagonal plates are put into a cue on the table. They are the playing board. Who has struggled through all events, and has reached the modern times?

name: Wimmelburger
description:
Welcome to Wimmelburger -Restaurant.

Here you can make your hamburger yourself, but there are not only tasty ingredients, but also uneatable ones that can be on that burger.
Before you finish a hamburger by putting the "upper half card" on the open deck you should convince yourself that you don't have any minus cards inside. The player with the most ingredients cards wins.

name: Die kleinen Biber bauen einen Damm
description: Together all of the beavers try to save the dam from the rising water. They get logs out to the woods in order to repair the beaver dam. Only when the beavers are fast enough will they win against the water.

name: Das Eieruhr-Spiel
description:
Each player tries to get his six markers from the bottom row no. 6 through the sand glass to the opposite row no. 6.
The player who reaches this opposite row first is the winner.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Hungriger Hai
description: A hungry shark is on his way to eat fish caught in the nets of the fishermen. The fishermen decide to work together and hunt this shark. The fisherman are strongest when 5 are in the same boat, so they have to plan how they can get 5 together. The Shark is caught when the 5 fishermen and the shark are together on a light blue field, then the fishermen have won. If the shark makes it to his cave then he has won.
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Das Kofferkarussell
description:
During unloading of an airplane all suitcases on the plane have been dropped and opened. The contents of the suitcases got messed up. Everyone has since quickly filled the suitcases again, but what is inside my suitcase now?
The game ends when all passengers have found their suitcases. The player with the highest score wins.

name: Sonne, Mond und Sterne
description: The trip starts on the moon and leads to a wild odyssey to the sun. With luck and some playing with numbers you are able to send back some space stations and with them skillfully move yourself forward. The winner is the player who reaches the pink star with the 6 on the sunbeam first.

name: Größer als ein Autobus
description:
Three different word games can be played with the material.
As an example the first game:
Playing Passt in jeden Koffer' (="fits in every suitcase") the game leader thinks about a word and puts the matching character cards in wrong order on the table. Each player tries to find the word first to get the attribute card.

name: Ein Kamel, ein Kamel...
description: Each player must try to get rid of his cards as fast as possible. That happens by laying out his cards in a maximum of 4 rows on the table or on the decks of opposing players Whoever lays down all his cards first is the winner and takes the camels.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Vogelhochzeit
description:
Each player gets a pawn which is moved by a die and cards with pictures of male birds. The cards of the female birds are put face down on the board
The players try to find as many fitting cards with female birds as possible. The winner is the player with the most pairs of birds.

name: Fünf vor Zwölf
description:
The game idea is to save the earth from suffocation in garbage. The players move over the board hitting fields with question cards and action cards. The right answers provide green chips. 3 chips can be traded in for a puzzle segment of nature that covers the garbage. Wrong answers and bad action cards provide black points which let the clock move towards the 12!
Is the landscape totally filled with nature puzzles the players have won.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement

name: Weihnachtsmann: zieh dich an
description: Each player tries to provide Santa Claus with a cap, coat, sack, pants and boots and to reach one of the red marked finish fields with one pawn.

name: Beddy-Bye Baby Game
description:
The Darling Dash to Tuck Baby into Bed! It's beddy-bye time and it's up to you to collect a teddy bear,pajamas and bottle and tuck your baby into bed. Before you know it, your precious little bundle of joy will be all snuggled up and fast asleep!

Contents: Game board,48 playing cards,4 tokens with stands,1 rattle die,rules.

name: Cool Chicken
description:
A board and card game designed to help develop library skills.

Contents:
- gameboard
- game cards
- markers + guides
- poster

name: Know Mosquitoes
description:
From Henderson (2003):

"This game is Monopoly-style game that incorporates knowledge of mosquito biology and control. It consists of 2 dice, 12 game pieces, 140 ‘Question and Answer’ cards, and 32 Life Cycle cards. As players answer questions correctly they move their game piece and attempt another question. An extensive glossary of terms with definitions is included."

Henderson, Julie Price. Annotated Bibliography: Mosquito Educational Tools for Children. Winnipeg: Natural Resources Institute, University of Manitoba, 2003.

name: Big Board Raiders
description:
From the publisher's website bigboardraiders.net :

I do not have any affiliation with any investment entity and I am not encouraging anyone to invest in anything. This is intended for your entertainment and learning.

I think we all know young boys or girls who seem like they were hard-wired for finance. When the subject of money is being discussed, they are right there like spounges soaking it up. I know because I was one of them, but my parents didn't take the time to teach me about money. Today lots of parents still don't teach their kids enough about money, and yet our kids will all deal with money most days in their lives and how early they begin to understand money, will directly influence their lifestyle. This game is for parents to encourage those little finance prodigies. The world is changing to where the cash in your hand is the crumbs from the table, while the banquet is inside the corporations. For Grade 5 and up, but best for teens and up.

The “Big Board” is like a nickname for Wall Street, while “Raiders” are the teams of entrepreneurs, lawyers, accountants, brokers and investment bankers who engaged in hostile takeovers of the companies they pursue. In Big Board Raiders, players can gang-up by pooling their capital to promote a cause or stop another player, but alliances don’t last forever and when they end, backstabbing is an inevitable strategy. Communication and deal making are very important enhancements to a player’s game strategy. A few choice words can help your portfolio or have the opposite effect on your opponent’s. It’s all about opportunities, timing and the hustle.

There are two main objectives players engage in while playing Big Board Raiders; the first is to get elected by proxy as a director of a company and the second is to grow your portfolio using the many investment vehicles, so that you will have the capital to make your move to control your company; the company in which you were elected to the board by proxy. There are four trading companies: Yellow, Blue, Red, and Green. Six Subsidiaries, and each of these subsidiaries has a proxy vote that it gives to the players as they land on their subsidiary space on the game board. To win, grow your capital while collection the proxy votes to be elected as a director, then buy enough shares to take over control of that company.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Poppo
description:
From website:

"Peter Poppo™ and his pals come together in this exciting new game specially designed for emerging readers. Kids and adults alike will love popping the poppers to race to spell words from the 100 colorfully illustrated picture cards.

Your child pops the lettered dice in the poppers and matches them with the word or picture on the card. Being able to rearrange and assemble letters into words in a fast paced setting is challenging and fun. Matching, grouping, and sorting are all skills involved in this challenging fast-paced activity game from Poppo Brands™.

Each round takes up to 60 seconds – perfect for young attention spans – so your kids will love to play again and again."

Ages 4 and up

name: Paul Wing's Spelling Bee
description:
from Radio Game Show Games: This early effort predates what are generally considered to be the first game shows. Players drew chips from a bag to determine which word on the host's card they had to spell correctly. Paul Wing was an author and NBC staff director. His show was originally heard only in the cities competing in each weekly broadcast, but the program did eventually (and briefly) gain full network status. Cutting costs even in the 1930s, Milton Bradley's materials for this game were identical to the ones used in Vox Pop.

The game was played by choosing a word caller, then going around the room and having people pull numbered disks out of a bag; the number on the disk determined the word you would spell (and some words were notably easier than others, so it was a bit of a game of chance). Correct moves got you a little green counter called a "honey," and wrong moves got you a little red counter called a "stinger" (because it's a bee, get it?)

name: The Prez
description:
From the publisher's website:

Now you can run your own presidential campaign!

Campaign finances, strategic debates and racking up those all important electoral votes could lead you to a stunning victory on the "wild and wacky run for the White House"™!

Choose your home state, begin visiting states to establish campaign headquarters and line up workers until you gain control of a state to receive its electoral votes. Strategically timing debates with other candidates and budgeting your campaign finances while trying to stay out of the spin zone are all part of the fun!

Before the first round is over, you'll know why key states have played important parts in the recent elections and as the last round is played you will have a new appreciation of the total commitment required when striving to gain the electoral votes needed for the U.S. presidency.

Home Page: http://www.theprez.net/
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Politics Party-Pun
description: This game from 1960 consists of two six-sided dice showing heads and tails of elephants and donkeys. Intended as something to encourage people to vote, the game play is similar to put-and-take.

name: Fare Game
description:
Each player drives a taxi cab that they use to pickup passengers from locations determined by dice rolling to a destination determined by a dice rolling.

Payment is determined by the route taken and the distance traveled.

Intersections can provide an advantage or a disadvantage to each player. Intersections can be clear, have lights or be completely blocked, which changes the route chosen by the players.

Players can also get in each others way.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Pablo Junior
description:
This is a game where you build 3-D abstract art pieces based on similarities to Pablo Picasso, hence the name. Publisher Fox Spielverlag pitches this as "a stick game with unlimited possibilities." However, there are no "rules" per se. This is more of a "creative expression" product.

Pablo Jr. is actually a 4-part product [1 of 4 boxes is currently represented]. Each "Junior" box contains 25% of the bits contained in Fox Spielverlag's Pablo "big-box" edition.

name: Räuberwald
description: The pawn (the player who is courageous enough to cross the robber woods) walks slowly through the forest. When it reaches a field that matches a card that the player has coins are dealt as a reward. The player who has the most valuable coins at the end wins the game.

name: Delicio
description:
Delicio, the yummy food game

Object of the game:
The first player to fill his or her plate with a balanced meal wins.

How to play:
Spread all the pieces of "food" out on the table, facedown, around the central board. Each player takes a "plate", which has 8 colored squares on it.

Roll the six-sided die to move around the circular central game board and stop on a colored square. Turn over a card corresponding to that color and place it on your plate.

Each colored space corresponds to a food group. Each food card is identified by a color next to the food.

Red: meat and other protein (e.g. beans)
Yellow: breads and cereals
Green: fruits and vegetables
Blue: dairy products

Plates have one red, one blue, two yellow, and three green squares.

name: Schwerpunkt! Decline and Fall of the German Armour Weapon, East Front 1944-1945
description:
Schwerpunkt! is a tactical game of combat on the East Front in the last two years of World War 2. Units are squad-sized, hexes represent about 100 meters across, and game turns are 60 to 120 seconds of real time. Six small scenarios are provided.

The rules are short and succinct, with no real surprises from the standard igo/ugo practice, with one exception ... players alternate, not in taking their full turns, but in initiating combat until all combat is completed, and then in moving until all eligible units have moved. This tends to slow the game down somewhat, but the benefit is the ability of the players to respond to threats in a more timely manner.

The components include four geomorphic map sheets, each 8.5"x11"; six pages of rules; and 166 uncut counters. The production quality is low as the game, as well as the magazine in which it came (more on that in a moment) is photocopied. Photocopied, remember, using 1977 technology.

The magazine is Volume 1 Number 1, and therefore Issue 1, of Combat!, the International Magazine of Conflict Simulations. It's published by Wellington Wargames, also known as Swedish Games Productions, the brainchild of Fredrik Malmberg, who is himself a bit of a prodigal. He began his wargame producing career in earnest when he was 14 years old (see his design 'Fight for Tobruk!') Only 200 copies of The Combat issue 1 were printed.

name: Artiste
description: With much finger skill all players try together to build a tower, as high as possible. The player who gets rid of his pawns first wins the game.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Mein erstes Rechenspiel: Wir rechnen von 1 bis 20
description: With the number cards and the operational sign cards the player puts a math problem on the table and tries to solve it. If he counted correctly, he receives the math card and throws the die again, in order to push the pawn forward. Whoever reaches the treasure chest in this way first, wins.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Math, Number

name: AppLEOpoly
description:
AppLEOpoly is a promotional game published by the Leo Burnett Company, Inc to give to their employees on their 54th anniversary. The game is basically a Monopoly clone but with a few differences. For example, the house rule of collecting money when landing on Free Parking is an actual rule in AppLEOpoly. (The space is called "Free Coffee.")

The name comes from Leo Burnett Company's tradition of leaving Apples at the reception desk for visitors. Consequentially, the "Go" space on the board is called "Reception Desk" and is illustrated with a bowl of Apples." Other squares are accounts that the company holds. The "Jail" square is called "Working Weekend."
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Greater Miamiopoly
description: Greater Miamiopoly is a clone of Monopoly. The real estate squares are all advertisements for Miami businesses, sports teams, and media. This game used to be given away by the Miami Herald newspaper as a business present.
mechanics: Enclosure, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Orangeopoly
description:
From the manufacturer:

We're Orange Together!
Buy, sell and trade Syracuse University! The Quad, the Carrier Dome, Hendricks Chapel and University Avenue are all for up for sale. A game for all alumni, students and fans of Syracuse University!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: A Tour Through the British Colonies and Foreign Possessions
description:
A Tour Through The British Colonies and Foreign Possessions is from an original hand coloured lithographic game published in about 1850 by John Betts of London. The game is a whistle-stop tour around the world from London via Africa, India, Japan, the West Indies, the United States of America, Canada, and finally, a race back to London. The first part of the journey includes the choice of two routes. The overland journey visits the city of Alexandria and the sea cruise calls in at Sierra Leone and the Cape.

With 36 stops along the route, the visitor participates in a remarkable, colonial experience of the world.

The game includes a box, mounted color map, reproduction rule book and catalog, The Historical Games Collection catalog, four re-created pawns lightly tipped in colors, and a six sided teetotum (spinner - dice were considered at the time as something used for gambling).

Game play involves spinning, moving your pawn the appropriate number of spaces, and then reading the educational paragraph about the colony or possession you have landed on.

The reproduction edition's rulebook notes: "These rules are copied directly from the originals and reflect the moral and social outlook of early 19th century imperialist peoples. The facts and attitudes are often wrong, intolerant and patronizing and should be read from a historical perspective."

name: The Noble Game of Elephant and Castle or Travelling in Asia
description:
The Noble Game of Elephant and Castle was first published in 1822 as a hand coloured engraving by William Darton of London.

The game is played on a magnificent board depicting an elephant surmounted by a howdah (ornate carriage) with an Indian mahout (driver). The mysteries of the Orient are discovered through a grand tour from the Frozen Ocean in the Arctic wastes of north Russia thence south through Asia into India, China, and Japan. The game was published at the height of the British Empire and outrageously describes the appearance, customs and culture of the region's peoples, comparing their way of life to that of the British.

The game comes in a box with a mounted full color reproduction board, reproduction rules, Catalog of The Historical Games Collection, four "travelers" (pawns) - each lightly tipped with a different color, 16 counters (chips, each with the rose face lightly colored to match pawns), and a teetotum (top with eight sides, numbered 1-8 - dice being items of gambling).

Each player spins and moves their pawn a number of spaces, attempting to progress to 25 by exact count. Each space has a description in the accompanying rule book to be read aloud, describing the scene from an area of Asia. The counters are used to mark off missed turns assigned by the descriptions.

The rules note: "These rules are copied directly form the originals and reflect the moral and social outlook of early 19th century imperialist peoples. The facts and attitudes are often wrong, intolerant and patronizing and should be read from a historical perspective."
publishers: Barnsbury Antiques, Historical Games Company, Wm. Darton

name: Deep Sea-Opoly
description:
From the manufacturer:

Cast off on an excursion that’s fun from the time you leave the dock till you head back to shore! This is a game for those who REALLY reel in the big ones... or those who just dream big.

Buy your properties and then increase the value by adding bodies of water and big fish. As you play, turn over the deeds and learn interesting facts and helpful fishing tips too!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Fortress
description:
A set of rules which can be played on any map showing political subdivisions. The players take turns placing one piece at a time on the mapboard in order to capture territories. Pieces may not be placed into enemy held spaces, and a player may not have more than three pieces in a single space. The diceless combat system requires you to establish a larger force in spaces adjacent to those occupied by the enemy. The game continues until both players pass, at which time the victor is the player who controls the most spaces.

The game was inspired by the 1983 SSI computer game Fortress, which was played on a 6x6 grid and limited to 21 turns.

name: Der Maulwurf hilft!
description: In the spring time as the sun rises and toads go on a journey, traffic becomes dangerous for them. In this game the toads walk on the motorway. We must save them with the help of the mole. There are tunnels under the motorway. If we are able to get all of the toads into a tunnel we win.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Bedrijvenspel
description:
Monopoly-like game with versions of different cities.

Players roll two dice. A red die and a white one. Players roll and move their pawns along the local different companies in a city. When a player lands on a company, he/she has to buy the property or pay the owner rent. If a player has a set of companies of the same color the rent rises.
Each turn a player has to take a card based on the roll of the red die. The game ends when one player owns all property.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Croky showspel
description:
A free promotional game from the chips brand Croky, combining roll-and-move with memory.

Each player plays a different parrot (that stands for one the the tastes).

Publisher nor year is indicated. However if I recall correctly, this game stems from the mid 1980s.

name: Goodbye....
description:
In this game, players race to move four pawns from their starting positions around the board into their "Home Country." Basic gameplay resembles Pachisi or Sorry!, but there are a couple of twists. First of all, movement is controlled by a deck of standard playing cards (with some extra Aces and Kings) -- most cards move a pawn forward by their face value, but some have special powers (get a pawn out of the starting area, move multiple pawns, trade places, move backwards, etc.). Additionally, while the game can be played as a free-for-all, it is also possible for players to split into partnerships and aid their partners in the race to victory.

The game is subtitled "An International Card Game," featuring rules in eight different languages and decorating its board with the flags of many of the countries where it can be played.

name: Schnarchkonzert
description: Each player tries to eat full with cards of food points so that it can oversleep the winter in its hiding place. Who gets over the “winter sleep” without starving first, wins.

name: Platz da!
description: Each of the two or 4 players chooses a color and puts his 5 pawns on the start fields of the same color. The point is to bring the own pawns across the board to the opposite finish fields. The player who is there with his 5 pawns wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid, Static Capture

name: Quizkoenig
description: A quiz-game from the fifties - the player gets the question card. Either the player who is asked, the questioning player or the referee can answer it.

name: Ich Fahr' Fair
description:
A trivia game based on the traffic safety campaign "Ich Fahr' Fair" (roughly: "I drive considerately"). Players earn puzzle pieces by answering multiple-choice, traffic trivia questions in six categories. Correct answers allow a player to roll again and continue their turn.

Contents; Game board, 6 wooden car pawns, question cards with answers, 6 puzzles with 6 pieces, rules and a dice.
Note; the game is only available in a German language version.

name: Audacity!
description:
This two-player strategy game is based on trying to cross the board with your pieces to get into a goal area, removing it. The first player to get 3 of his pieces into the goal wins.

The unusual mechanic to this game is that you can move any piece on your turn, yours or your opponent's, any unblocked distance on a line. If you move your pieces, the end space must have a different number of adjacent pieces from the space where it started, while if you move an opposing piece, it must end adjacent to the same number of pieces.

name: Clubhouse Golf Dice Game
description:
Clubhouse Golf Dice Game loosely simulates a round of golf through the same scoring system - the lower the number of strokes, the better your score. The game comes with 5 dice: A white Tee die, a light green Fairway (F) die, a blue Water (W) die, a yellow Sand (S) die and a dark green putting (G for Green) die. Except for the putting die, the dice have letters on them indicating the next die to be cast. The putting die has numbers on it.

Each hole, a player starts by rolling the Tee die (the first stroke). Subsequently, the player rolls the next die indicated by the previous die, adding one stroke to their score for each die rolled. However, when the Water die is rolled, the player adds 2 strokes instead. When the Green (G) is rolled, the player rolls the putting die and adds the number rolled to his/her score - the hole then ends for that player and his/her score is the number of strokes played. Players can play 18 holes for a full round of golf. The lowest total score wins.

It's easier to get a hole-in-one in this game than in real golf - roll 'G' on the Tee die, followed by a roll of '0' on the putting die.

name: Tacoma Trivia
description: For 2-4 players or teams interested in the trivia of Tacoma Washington. Comes with a colorful board and trivia cards. For Ages 13 and up

name: Zwergen-Rennen
description:
Content:
board, 4 wooden dwarves, 8 jewels, 4 "rope" stones, 1 die

The game idea is for your dwarf to cross over the canyon using the log , then to unload the jewel, run back, pick up the second jewel,balance it across the canyon once again and unload it a second time and finally to run back to the starting place. The whole thing done as fast as possible and without falling down.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Highway Mary Kay
description:
This boardgame simulates the life of a Mary Kay sales consultant, as she goes from consultant to National Sales Director and earns the highest possible amount of money.

The game includes the board, 4 markers, 1 die, playing money(Pinks), 200 Recruit Cards, 25 Consultant Cards, 20 Director Cards, 75 Offspring Director Cards.

There are minor obstacles to overcome, and players must recruit and sell, win contests, attend the Seminar, and eventually earn a Mercedes and attain the position of National Sales Director.

name: Fast Game System
description:
A system of simple map, movement, and command rules designed to be used with any skirmish miniatures rules.

The designer says: "FGS is a simple system to be used as a support for skirmish miniature rules. The idea is quite simple: to provide a mechanism to make it possible to move your figures without any ruler while keeping the special 'feeling' of the 3-dimensional terrain."

"FGS is composed of two parts: the Movement System and the Command System; both systems can be used independently: the Movement System can be easily introduced on every existing skirmish rule to allow an easy management of the figures on the 3-dimensional map. The Command System can be used to create non-deterministic sequences of play."

name: Der Zahlen-Markt
description: The idea of the game is to buy as many products as possible with your own money. At the end, the player who has bought the most items wins.

name: Genom det svartaste Afrika
description:
Simple roll-and-move game of traveling in Africa. The game consists of a cardboard folder w/an 8-fold game board paper map attached. No tokens or dice are provided.

The game consists of a series of events, triggered by landing on their respective space. The event legends are described in simple rhymes, and tie in with the board illustrations. They can be beneficial as well as bad. Players race to be first to #100.

The game is probably from the late 1920ies or early 30ies, due to spelling and art style. No copyright date is attached.

The art was provided by painter & illustrator Einar Torsslow, and may be considered mildly racist today (the Negroes are depicted with black-face), and there is a reference to cannibals in event #62. The tone is more that of a childrens adventure tale than anything else, though.

The following information is provided on the back of the folder: Akt. bol. Ernst Frick & Co. / Stockholm / Pris 2:75 / Haeggströms lito. 200302
publishers: Akt. bol. Ernst Frick & Co., Stockholm

name: Soda Pop
description: Subtitled "A Primary Pop-O-Matic Game", this is a simple color-matching game for children Ages 4 - 7. Each player has their own "factory" pegboard and a soda bottle peg in a matching color. The pegboard shows columns of bottles in red, yellow, green, or two-color stripes. The player pops the Pop-O-Matic bubble and moves the peg to a space matching that color. The first one to the top of their board wins.

name: Bibi Blocksberg Hexen-Einmaleins
description: Bibi Blocksberg and her 3 witch friends got a detention class: Their lesson: Her multiplication class was not successful. Therefore they need practice. They need to collect chips for the detention first. Winner is the player with the most points.

name: Bishop Rick
description: This is a family/children's card game aimed at the LDS (Mormon) community. The game uses a rule set somewhat similar to that of an "Old Maid" type card game. The cards include information related to callings/positions people hold in the LDS church.

name: Articles of Faith Card Game
description: This is a trivia/memory card game aimed at the LDS (Mormon) community. Players receive cards with "Articles of Faith" (statements of religious belief) on them, then compete to see who can recall and recite back the statements, using a die to determine how much of the statement will have to be remembered.

name: Lustiges Begriffe-Raten
description: This game is a really funny and creative quiz game which children like to play. Out of 440 funny sentences creative children develop a lot more brain teasers.

name: Finger weg von meiner Kohle!
description:
Do you have so little pocket change that you can't get through the month? Do you want to stop to this! With this game you quickly learn how you can add to your pocket money so that you have more money at the end of the month. But be careful: Everywhere there are dangerous opportunities to spend that extra money again. You have to be steady to overcome those temptations. Then you will become "pocket money king"!
Similar to Das Taschengeld Spiel

name: Spiel-Hölle
description: At a round course of the board there are 6 gambling halls where you can play two or 3 different games of luck.

name: Sticky Wicket
description: Sticky Wicket! The Sticky Wicket Cricket board game in a slim-line portable flip top case for Cricketers, Coaches, Cricket Fans and Umpires worldwide. Whenever rain stops play, do not despair just open up your umbrella and the Sticky Wicket Cricket board game and carry on playing on this perfectly packaged portable game in a slim-line case. If you have got a cricketer or a cricket fan in your life, regardless of which County or Country they support, this slim-line Cricket board game might be the perfect celebration gift or you could, of course, just keep it for yourself. This is a Quikky dice rolling game with simple rules for 2 players of any age from Ages 9 and up and each player plays a full innings both batting or bowling - test match style, county style, limited over or Twenty20.

name: Clip-on
description: The idea is to build words out of the deck of characters or to snatch them away from other players and to win with the longest chain of words.

name: Poder Galáctico
description:
You don't have it easy at all, since your adversaries are going to treat to prevent you winning the game, but you have to try to be the first one establishing your bases on five planets of foreign control, it means, out of your planetary system of origin.

Bloody game of planetary strategy to the old usage.

CONTENT:
- Instructions
- Board
- 20 red balls
- 20 yellow balls
- 20 blue balls
- 20 green balls
- 4 big balls of every previous color
- 4 stands
- 1 plastic box
- 20 cartons of power
- 50 cards
- 4 spacecrafts

Amuse yourself conquering the galaxy, alliances and perfidies will be on play.

name: Bull Chase
description:
After pitching their tents in the dark, campers awake to find that they have slept in the wrong colored tents! To their horror, they also find they are in a field full of bulls! The campers hurriedly try to reach their own tent to leave for home, but first have to cross the field and avoid the bulls.
The pieces are plastic people and the bulls are detailed plastic with flipper fronts, so they can toss the campers!

name: Stora skandiska kriget
description:
Stora skandiska kriget is a traditional hex-and-counter magazine game that came with the Swedish fanzine "Den fjättrade gåsen" #6, February 2004.

The game includes a cardboard map, size A4, an OOB, also A4, and a set of uncut laser printed counters. The magazine itself includes the rules and is of A5 size.

There are two scenarios, named "Vasakriget" & "Operation kuling" with two different countries & thus sets of units, both utilizing the same map. Both scenarios are set in the world of the Swedish post-apocalyptic RPG Mutant 2, of 1980:ies vintage.

name: Goofy & Max: Ärgern macht Spaß!
description:
In this game the object is to move your pawns across the finish line as fast as possible. But pay attention - the pawns have two sides with different characters on them and are turned to the other side on each turn of a player.
So it may happen that a pawn moved across the finish line by the first player could then be moved by an opponent to the opponents finish line. The player who brings home the most pawns wins.
categories: Animals, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Lucky Puck
description: Two player Electronic Ice Hockey game where both you and your opponent can control each of the six players on your team in order to try and get the correct position from which you can score a goal.

name: Buchstaben-Beutel
description:
Actually a collection of five word-finding games, players alternately place markers on letters and must e.g. build a sentence containing only words starting with covered letters.
The "board" is actually a piece of leather which can be folded as the bag where game markers will be put in.
All comes in a small wooden block.

name: Ancestors
description:
This is a Mormon game which teaches about Mormon genealogy and their family sealing practices on a monopoly type board, with a separate board where one collects cards relating to family members, and then tries to collect other cards to unite those family members.

From submitters' memory:

The Gameboard was a dark color, and composed of dark colors, but basic layout was like a monopoly board. At the corners it had side routes which you could choose to go on instead of the main route. These would have slightly longer detours around the corners. You would roll one die and advance that many spaces. On each space were opportunities to earn money, spend money, find ancestors and locate ancestors. If you found an ancestor, you obtained a blue (boys) or pink (girls) card representing that ancestor which you then put on your own board (which you had in front of you) which represented you and all your ancestors. The idea was to collect all these ancestors (such as brother, mother, sister, grandmother, grandfather, etc.) and put their cards in their respective portions of this board. Once you had them all, the next goal was to seal/unite them all together. You did this mainly on those side routes, which was where you could get sealing cards. You would put these cards (one per link between each ancestor) to connect the ancestors together. The first person to connect all their family/ancestors together won the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Circular Chess
description:
This chess variant follows the basic rules of chess, but adapts them to a unique, circular board. (The board layout was patented in the U.S. by the designers.) The pieces are set up identically to normal chess. A ninth diameter (file) is added, but with unplayable spaces in the first two circles (ranks). This prevents the pieces in the first rank from directly attacking each other. The rules also include castling and capturing en passant.

This game is distinctly different from Byzantine Chess and Circular Chess (the latter developed by David Reynolds), using a different board layout, set-up, and rules.

name: Binary Dice
description:
From the back of the game box:
BINARY DICE are the hottest and most versatile new concept in dice since the cube was invented. A single set of BINARY DICE can replace all those multi-sided dice: with 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 16, 20 and 30 sides. Simply use as many BINARY DICE as needed in each case: the two or three lowest in an ordinary family game, or all five for deciding an important outcome to within a resolution of 3%.
Contents: 5 × BINARY DICE, rules for Binary Yatzy and Binary 3 in a Row."

The set consists of just 5 little white square tiles, each of which is blank on one side and bears a number (1, 2, 4, 8 or 16) on the other. The dice can be used to play two games - Binary Yatzy (A Yatzee-like game that has an innovative scoring grid which adds an extra dimension to consider when taking one's score) and Binary 3 in a row (Tic-tac-toe using the binary dice - players cast the first 3 binary dice and then must flip one of them before using the total sum to place their mark, so there is some thought involved).

name: ELECTION! The Election Game
description:
From the publisher's website:

ELECTION! The Election Game is a fun new board game which puts you on the road to the White House! Roll the die and move around the board collecting Money, Lobby, Vote and Politics cards. First, get elected to Congress, then the Senate, and, if you collect enough Votes , move to the inner circle, occupy the White House and WIN THE GAME! But watch out! There are many pitfalls along the way! Opponents can freeze you in place with a FILLIBUSTER! card, or steal your Votes with a REDISTRICTING card! But you can fend off their attacks with SPIN CONTROL! cards! Ten different Politics cards; thousands of scenarios!

ELECTION! The Election Game combines skill, luck and strategy in a simplified and non-partisan game that makes light of the hijinx that characterize American politics and the election process. It is easy enough for anyone to quickly enjoy, but requires enough strategy to make players think and plan ahead.

name: L'auto écolo
description: L'auto écologique is a game about ecological cars and ecology in general. The goal is to go from one end of the board to the other more quickly than your opponents. Each move costs "Oxygen", which supply is limited. To earn "Oxygen" players must answer questions about ecology.

name: Hexciting Connection
description: The players place tiles on the game board and gets points depending on what hexes the tiles cover. New tiles need to connect nicely to previous tiles. Each turn, a player only has two tiles to choose from, which makes it possible for players to destroy for each other by looking at each others options and make sure none of them is good.

name: Go Plates
description: Colorful, excellent artwork. Gospel Cards for families. Plays like "Go Fish" or "Concentration". Simple enough for youngsters, lots of teaching opportunities.

name: Scripture Search & Spell Book of Mormon
description: Everyone get your own set of scriptures and gather around a table with your family, class, or study group. Turn over a reference card, and the race is on! The first person to find the reference, figure out the key word, with the clue given, and spell it out with the letter tiles is the winner!
categories: Party Game, Racing, Religious, Word Game

name: Nutty Cups
description:
Publishers Description:

"Stack the seven cups with Nutty Guys on the bottoms. Keep track of the nutty characters as the cups are stacked and re-stacked. But can you un-stack the cups to reveal a set with matching characteristics?

This lively game really stacks up! Take the Nutty Challenge!"

name: Reise Durch das Bistum Osnabrück
description:
From the box--

Kurzbeschreibung: Das Spiel zeigt das Bistum Osnabrück mit vielen wichtigen und interessanten Orten. Es will Eindrücke und Wissen vermittein. Gleichzeitig ist das Spiel ein schönes Gemeinschaftserlebnis für Kinder, Jugendgruppen und die gesamte Familie.

There are cards with this kind of phrase on them: Zähle Frauenorden auf, die in unserem Bistum tätig sind. Je 2 Punkte.

And larger cards with pictures and information about the pictures. Player pawns and one green die.

It seems to be a tour of memorable sites in Osnabrück, with a point system.

name: Reach
description: Reach is an LDS card game. The game features two identical decks of 80 cards, each featuring a scripture from The Bible, The Book of Mormon, The Doctrine and Covenants, or the Pearl of Great Price. One deck is spread on the table face up and the other is given to "a reader." This player reads the scripture on a card from his/her and then the other players race to find it on the table. After all 80 cards are read, the player who found the most face up cards is the winner.

name: Ripleys Believe It or Not! Library of Cards
description:
This is a compact library of the strange and fascinating oddities of the world, all authenticated by Ripley. These cards are enjoyable to adults as to children of all ages.

The exciting feature of these cards is the game of Ripley Rummy that can be enjoyed by the whole family. Follows the traditional rules of the popular Rummy card game. Be the first to get rid of all your cards by collecting and playing sets of cards.

name: C.O.W. (Cybernetic Omni-tasking Workcow)
description:
C.O.W. or Cybernetic Omni-tasking Workcow is a board game that is similar to a 1980's computer game called M.U.L.E.

Players start by purchasing a land of out of a pool. They can also buy workcows to farm the land to produce the resources. During the market phase, players buy or sell the resources to other players or the store to make profit or simply to keep their farm running.

Players must also deal with random events that may effect their production and at the same time, they must be cunning enough to survive the brutal market manipulation by other players.

Ultimately, the first player who reaches a specific wealth wins the game.
categories: Economic, Farming, Science Fiction, Territory Building

name: The United States Air Mail Game
description:
Not to be confused with the card game Wings: The Air Mail Game (also known as Aviation: The Air Mail Game).

The United States Air Mail Game is a board game that features a picture of a blue airplane on the front and a map of the USA on the board with metal airplane for playing pieces.

name: The Garrison Game
description: In this early abstract wargame, 50 soldiers need to move across the board and capture a fortress held down by 3 officers. The board consists of colored diamonds connected by lines, presumably for point-to-point movement. The box front displays the title prominently with several flags and a couple of cannons.

name: Jeu de l'histoire sainte depuis la naissance de Moïse jusqu'à sa mort
description:
This game is literally a work of art.

It's a French game about the life of Moses from circa 1800 where the gameboard is engraved on a copper plate. There are 62 small engraved images, one in each of the spaces of the movement track. The gameboard has a movement track that spirals in toward the center of the board in an oval. The game instructions are in French in the center of the oval.

The board sold for $535 in Feb 2008.

name: Le Jeu Joli
description:
La Jeu Joli uses a board with four main areas (starting spots, outer ring, middle ring and center/finish), with other paths which connect the these areas. The game uses the blockade and capturing concepts of Pachisi.

Players may move in either direction on their turn and may move the number indicated by one die or both dice. A player may move from one path to the next and into the finish circle only over his colored path. The first player to get all his markers to the finish circle wins.

name: The Nanchang Rebellion
description:
This game is the first in the Oriental Flagship Company's "Red Remembrances" series. This simple game simulates the August 1, 1927 Nanchang Rebellion, when Communist forces first rebelled against the Kuomintang.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nanchang_Uprising
The game uses roughly 40 magnetic counters on a board with a hexagonal grid, a die, and a set of event cards. According to the semi-hidden movement rules, counters only reveal their equipment and capabilities when discovered according to the rules.
publishers: Oriental Flagship (BEIJING) International Technology CO., LTD

name: Quien Sabé
description:
A lesser known card game from the famous company although the rules state: "Quien Sabé has created the greatest sensation in games since our celebrated game of PIT".

A fast-paced game where every player gets an identical set of cards.

The leading player calls "down", and every participant chooses a card from his set and hides it from the others.
When the leading player calls "up" all cards are revealed simultaneously.
The object for each player now is to capture tricks in hopes that he may secure thereby a number of "count cards": Cards numbered 5, 10, 15 from the cowboy cards and Quien Sabé, the last mentioned being a special card.

Game is won after several rounds when a player has amassed at least 500 points.

name: Speedihound
description:
Game is presumably from the 1950ies and a greyhound racing betting game.

It consists of 6 x 8 suits of greyhound cards and one hare card.
Added is a rubber gameboard, enforced with raw canvas which also depicts the rules of the game.

Place your bets - and then one card after the other is turned up from the shuffled deck until one dog has laid out all his cards. Should the last card be the "disqualified" the dog is exactly that !

Can be played by any number of players as long everyone has counters (or money?) to bet...

name: Transcott
description:
Sub-Title of the game is:" Jeu des Routes du Ciel" which means in English: "Game of the Routes of the Sky".

It depicts the Lockheed "Super Constellation" on the box lid and is a trick taking game with special designed cards, depicting several service personnel from airlines on the time (1950ies).

Object of the game is to collect the cards to travel several air routes around the world.
To achieve this the cards not only depict suit and rank but also stops along the travel line.
The routes are shown on a separate gameboard.

Cards and box have luxury outfit: Thick cardboard cards with top and colourful printing quality, the box with lizzard skin finish and golden borders - nice !

name: Captain Cook: Voyage of Discovery
description:
Captain Cook : Voyage of Discovery is a simple roll & move educational game produced by Studio Press and the NSW Parks & Wildlife Service in 1969. The box proclaims:

'Relive the perils of Cook's historic first voyage...watch out for unfriendly natives...unfavourable winds...dangerous reefs and look forwards to exciting discovery unlimited..'

Players win the game by being the first to get their 'Endeavour' from the Portsmouth, England, to Botany Bay in Australia. The players move forward or backwards around the board track according to the cards that are drawn in sequence. No dice are used.

Players in the game are drafted randomly into several different roles of the Endeavour: Bosun, 1st Mate, Joseph Banks, and of course Captain Cook. Cook has a few privileges and winners of the race get to play him in other rounds of the game. Cook moves first and is essentially the dealer.

The game comes with an educational supplement published by the NSW Parks & Wildlife Service. The playing cards also contain illustrations and facts about some of the Flora & Fauna of New South Wales, Australia.

The game also came with 'historic cut out medals' that players were encouraged to pin on themselves in order to add the element of role-play.
mechanics: Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: NSW National Parks & Wildlife Service, Studio Press

name: Double Talk
description:
Contents:

Deck of 65 letter cards
4 player boards
2 dice
Instruction booklet


Deal the cards onto the spaces provided on each player's board. On your turn, a dice roll determines in which spaces you may switch cards or draw for a replacement. The first player to form two four-letter words on his board wins the round and scores the points in those words. Play a series of rounds until someone reaches the total required to win the game.

name: Warfare in the Ancient World: Wargames Rules for the Period 3000 B.C. to 500 A.D.
description:
Subtitled: wargames rules for the period 3000 BC to 500 AD

Miniatures rules in a 65 page A4 rules book with pull out quick reference sheet.

Troops classified for equipment, armour, training, morale and basic type. Includes classifications for prominent troop types from many armies in the back of the rules. Armies are split up into divisions.

Combat uses factors for troop type and situation and charts to calculate losses. Movement is according to pre-written orders.

Includes sections dealing with sieges and naval operations.
categories: Ancient, Book, Dice, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Primaries: 1980
description:
Players move around a Monopoly-like board in which each space represents a state, fund raising and spending the money to open campaign offices. Each office on a state increases the chances of collecting votes during primaries which are held on a fixed calendar at certain turns of the game. Movement is 0-5 squares at player's choice, but an end-of-turn die role introduces random events.

Strategy consists primarily of shrewd choice of states in which to compete -- you can spread over many small states, concentrate on a few large ones, or make some attempt at a hybrid. Player vs. player interaction is limited; the end-of-turn event roll gives you a 1/6th chance of being able to send an opponent to the Federal Election Commission space (which is, effectively, jail).
Components, unusually, include a cork board and colored pins. The game otherwise has poor production values by modern standards (it appears to have been a self-published one-shot and is more than 25 years old), but is redeemed by a simple and effective design.

This is a quick-playing, light-weight, clever game that exploits its topic well and is worth two or three plays in the unlikely event that you can find a copy.

It is regrettable that the game does not credit its designer, and the name of the publisher is an obvious joke punning on "gerrymander"

This game is long out of print and rare.

name: That's So Raven: Girl Talk
description:
Draw a card and read it out loud to your friends. Do you think the answer is totally YES? Do your friends say NO way, no how? Vote for what you think the correct answer is and see what Raven had to say about it. If your answer matches Raven's final answer, collect a gem.

The first player to place 5 gems on the gameboard is the winner Will it be you? Just Ask Raven!

Contents: Raven's crystal ball game unit, 46 question cards, 24 fortune disks, 20 plastic tokens, 4 Ask Again cards, 4 Yes/No chips, gameboard, instructions.

name: UBOS: El Juego
description:
UBOS (Ultimate Book of Spells)

Based in the children's animated television series which began production in 2001.

A game of magic and enchantments. In the center of the Earth are Cassy, Gus and Verne with UBOS. If you come there first you will be able to share with them infinite adventures, floods of magic and enchantments, in their fight against the Supreme Wizard Zarlak and his perverse followers.

The game objective is to be the first one putting both player pieces in the center of the board, in UBOS's place, where Cassy, Gus and Verne are waiting.

Content:

- 1 Board
- 1 Instructions card for the places
- 8 player pieces in 4 different colors
- 2 dices

name: Wonder Woman Game
description:
From the box top:
"Be the first to capture your assigned spy and link up with the orbiting Justice League Satellite!"

Each player plays a Wonder Woman. This allows for a bit of player interaction. When you land a spot occupied by another Wonder Woman you battle it out. Why would Wonder Woman fight herself? I have no idea.

name: Farmer in the Dell
description: An easy game for children to play. Each player has a side on the board that shows the Farmer, his wife, child, nurse, dog, cat, rat and cheese. Spin the spinner and match the correct pictures in order. Game pieces are used to cover each picture of the Farmer, wife, child, ect...as they go. The winner is the one who is first to spin and get the cheese.

name: Wonder Woman Game: Wonder Woman Saves the Amazonians
description: The first player to rescue the captives of Amazonia wins the game and becomes Wonder Woman.

name: Schikane
description:
Content:
board, 12 racing cars out of card board, 3 wooden dice

Each player gets three cars of the same color. 3 dice are the game motor. Each player tries to bring two of his cars as fast as possible to the white aim points. The cars get win points by the ranking of their arrival.
The player with the highest score is the winner.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Brontos: Sauriertreffen am Seerosenteich
description:
Content: board, 4 Brontos, 36 game stones

The Brontos meet near the water lily pond. They are pretty hungry so they eat their favorite food: water lilies. Everyone eats as much as they can get. Let's see who gets the most out of the pond.

The player who catches the most goodies and best memorizes what color they have can win.

name: Oho
description:
Each player tries to get all his chips to the finish line first. An unusual valuation provides an exciting race until the end.

Game No. 2 (of at least 12) in a family called "Miniplays"

name: Neu
description:
Content:
2 dice, 35 wooden chips

Object is to make much money as you can using your chips.
The motor used to play the game are two dice.

The game is No. 9 (of at least 12) in the family called "Miniplays"

name: Zug
description:
Content: board, 2 x 3 big dice, 6 wooden chips

Two players try to decide for themselves in as many rounds as possible how to get the highest scores possible out of the rolled dice. With a cute rule addition and 6 chips the game will be an exciting race.

This is game No. 3 (of at least 12) in a family called "Miniplays"

name: Mix
description:
Content: board, 3 big dice, 2 x 6 wooden chips

On there turn each player tries to get as high a score as possible by a mixture of the luck of the dice and his/her own decisions.

MIX is No. 7 (of at least 12) games in a family called "Miniplays".

name: Food Group Bingo
description: Educational children's game which teaches the food pyramid and nutritional categories of food. Players spin a spinner to get a category of food (such as "dairy" or "grains"). Players then locate an image of a food on their card that fits into that nutritional category. The first player to make a row of matches on their card wins.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Healthy Hurdles Nutrition Game
description: Educational game for children to teach about the USDA's new MyPyramid Food Guidance System and promotes physical fitness. Players spin and move, answer questions, and try to be the first to complete their pyramid. Includes 6 double-sided food pyramid game boards, 2 double-sided spinners, 2 die and 140 game cards. For 2-6 players.

name: Pearly Whites: A Dental Health Game
description:
Educational children game using the theme of dental health. The gameboard is a large, open mouth, and players move their pawns along the path of the teeth in the mouth.
Players spin, move, and answer true/false trivia questions about good oral hygiene in order to win.

From the publisher: "Take a bit out of dental visits with this game that's all about your choppers. Learn the names of teeth by moving around the mouth-shaped game board in Level 1 play. Answer true/false questions in Level 2 play to brush up on proper oral hygiene. Dental floss, mouth wash, toothpaste and toothbrush pawns offer another reason to smile. Also includes game board, spinner, 100 true/false question cards and guide."

name: Don't Tickle Elmo
description: Children's dexterity game themed on the popular Sesame Street character. Players compete to place plastic "feathers" into holes in the game board (depicting Elmo) and trying to not to "tickle" him, setting of a laughing alarm sound. Ages 3 - 5
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Wonder Checkers
description:
Wonder Checkers is a teaching implementation of Checkers. In addition to the regular checker board, the individual pieces are shaped like small cannisters, which open to reveal messages and prizes. The kit comes with stickers, customizable inserts, prize-tracking score sheets and game rules in quite a readable, logical sequence for new learners.

While the prizes supplied with the game are mere stickers and tokens, the designer suggests using jelly beans!

Wonder Checkers is part of a series which includes Wonder Chess, Wonder Go, and Wonder Letters, all of which are designed to teach standard rules and strategy of these classic abstract games by inserting intermediate rewards and tracking tools to motivate young learners.

On the reverse side of the board, an implementation of 3-d tic-tac-toe is also included.

Recommended for Ages 4 and up

name: Battle in a Bucket
description:
From the publisher:
"The ultimate game to communicate, create, gyrate and (sometimes) frustrate! You have 60 seconds to give the best clues - can your team guess the word you're describing? Spin the spinner to determine how you give your clues. This charades, drawing and word game is fun for the entire family and comes with 250 words to guess. For 4 or more players. Contents: 250 word cards, spinner, timer, score sheet, pencils and game rules - all packed in clear bucket with lid."

name: The Grand Corral
description:
From the publisher:
"Answer trivia questions about the wonderful world of horses - the various breeds, how they develop, where they live, how they're cared for, how they're ridden - each time you answer correctly you get to claim one of the 25 horses in the corral to your very own paddock. Collect the most and you win! Contents: 4 game boards (paddocks), 25 horse game figures, 25 game stands, 200 trivia cards, trivia card holder, games rules."

name: Dolphin Mania
description:
Contents:

Deck of 42 playing cards
5 reference cards listing the cards' ranks in order
9 information cards about the animals in the game
Instructions


From highest to lowest the cards rank Dolphin, Manatee, Alligator, Armadillo, Killer Whale, Sea Turtle, Numbers 12 down to 1, Flamingo, Eagle, Pelican, with two cards of each rank comprising the playing deck. Players are dealt a hand of seven cards and play out the tricks. On your turn, you must go higher if possible. If two like cards are played in the same trick, the second one beats the first. The winner is simply the player who has the highest card in the last trick.

The instructions say to devise your own scoring method if desired. They also include rules for a couple of variants in the rummy family.

name: That's So Raven "Tell It Like It Is" Game
description:
Social interaction/discussion style game based on the TV show.

From the publisher: "Join Raven, Chelsea, Eddie and Cory in this fun and "inquisitive" game. Who's your favorite teacher? Who's your crush? What's your favorite pizza topping? Get to know your friends by visiting their "corner" and answering questions. 2 to 4 players ages 7 and up.

Includes game mat, 32 friendship cards, 4 character tokens, 9 ch...ching tokens, psychic spinner and game rules.

name: Doodlebops Superstar Count 'n Match Game
description: This is a children's matching/counting game based on the theme of the popular children's show. Players spin numbers on a double spinner, count to/locate pieces and look for matches in order to win "CD" pieces. The first player to win three CD pieces.
categories: Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Number

name: Measuring Marathon Game
description: Players follow spinner directions to try to advance along a board representing a marathon. The first runner across the finish line wins. Multiple-choice questions quiz kids on measurement tools, length, weight, temperature and capacity, in both customary and metric scales. The marathon theme promotes fitness. Includes 125 questions cards, racer pawns, spinner and guide.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Math, Number, Trivia

name: Aufgepaßt-Nachgedacht!
description:
Turn the disk, and change the position of the pictures! Are you able to find the pairs behind the doors? Find all five pairs one after another, and you will win the game.

This is a variant of Husker Du?, but this game requires a player to find all the matches in one turn.
publishers: MB Jeux, MB Spiele, Milton Bradley

name: Reformation
description: Historical themed card game for 2 players depicting the Protestant break from the Catholic Church. One player is the Protestants, the other is the Catholics. Players use Faith cards to bid for control of different nations. There are separate Faith decks for each player and a shared deck of Nations. Some Faith cards have special powers that affect the Bidding. Some Faith cards have special Event powers that affect the game outside of the bidding. Faith cards have period titles such as Martin Luther, Edict of Nantes, and Council of Trent. A complete copy of the rules is available for free at: http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/Reform.html

name: N30: We Are Winning – The Battle of Seattle
description:
A game of the "Battle of Seattle" in 1999. Two players, 11x17" map, 168 counters. 13 pages of rules & 7 of notes. This is a complete redesign of N30 I and N30 II at a more detailed scale.

"N30 portrays the morning blockades of November 30th. Two players represent the opposing sides; one represents protesters; the other represents the police, with their incident commanders, Assistant Chief Ed Joiner and Captain Jim Pugel. The protesters aim to show that non-violent direct action can work, show that networked organizations can defeat hierarchical ones, and bring media attention to the issues. The police try to break the blockades and allow the conference to open as planned."

"Each turn represents 10 minutes. Each protester cluster represents 20-30 protesters, of whom 10-15 may be arrestables; each police hard or soft squad represents 10-15 police; each police mounted squad represents 6 police and each police chemical team represents 4 police (usually with 1 armored car). The police forces include most of the units of the Demonstration Management Team. They also include squads scrambled from the Convention Center venue (and/or other police units in the area)."
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Point to Point Movement

name: Frenzy
description: Six steel balls roll down a vertical board to land in various scoring bins at the bottom. A wind-up mechanism releases them individually onto the topmost of a series of steps that you tilt manually. The longer you can control a ball's descent to land on more steps without rolling off into the gutters, the more points it scores. But don't spend too much time concentrating on one ball because the next one will drop at any second. As you become more proficient, you can shorten the time between balls from Beginner to Expert.

name: Flip Flop Freezer Pops
description:
An Ice chest full of color matching and memory fun!

Open the cooler to color-matching chills and thrills! kids Try to match freezer Pop Cards to the Ice Cube Die after its dropped through the Ice Machine dice roller while building memory skills.

2 levels of play forAges 3 - 7 with no reading required.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Memory

name: Headline Deadline
description:
(from box back)

If you've ever read the newspaper or a magazine, listened to the radio or watched TV, you're sure to be a winner in Headline Deadline, the game where a little general knowledge goes a long way!

It's an outrageous game of strategy and insanity as headlines are read out loud and your teammates start yelling out related facts at a furious pace. But the seconds are flying by as you try to write down as many facts as your hand allows - all within a 30 second DEADLINE!

Oh, no! Time's up and the correct matches have to be tallied before you can move along the track, rolling and racing towards the finish. But was that your sweetheart's fact you forgot to write down? Geez! You'll never hear the end of it!!!
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Solobridge
description:
From front of the box:

The Real Bridge Game - Using Real Cards - Which You Play By Yourself

The Fun Way To Bid And Play Better

Learn And Improve You Game Guided By Experts

Included 50 Prepared Hands

For Beginners And Intermediate Players

name: Assault of the Ogroids
description:
Assault Of The Ogroids is a computer moderated solo board game published in the May 1987 issue of Sinclair User magazine, a computer magazine for the 8-bit SInclair ZX Spectrum.

The player takes the part of Deerfoot, a scout sent to gain aid for his city which is being besieged by the evil Ogroids. The board is a rectangle 12 spaces by 15 spaces, and the player wins the game by traveling across the board within 30 hours.

Every square entered takes a toll of the available time and the player's stamina. There are five different types of terrain, and the random encounters include finding useful items, meeting unfriendly monsters, becoming lost or finding a quicker route to your eventual goal. You lose once 30 game hours have passed, or if you are killed by a monster or other kind of encounter.

The computer program is approximately 90 lines of BASIC. It randomises numbers for combat and for encounters met along the way, and also keeps a track of the gold and items held by the player.

Gary Chalk designed the game and also illustrated it in a style familiar from the "Lone Wolf" game books.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Di End
description: Di End is very simple abstract game for 2 players. It could be played everywhere, every time, and could be played with chess or draughts (8x8) set. You've got 8 pawns each, all in 1. (or 8.) row. You must capture maximum possible number of opponents pawns in your turn. To win, you must capture all of opponents pawns or to move all your pawns which still are on the board to the last row. Ties are rare, but possible. You must pay attention, because it's possible to lose more than 5 pawns in one move, even if it doesn't look like. Easy to learn, hard (or maybe impossible) to perfect.

name: A Game of Cats and Mice, The Lost Diamond, and Gantlope
description: This is a turn-of-the-century board game published by the McLoughlin Brothers, and comprised of three distinct games: A Game of Cats and Mice, The Lost Diamond, and Gantlope. It has beautiful illustrations, and a double spinner component which seems to be made as an answer to negative stigma surrounding dice. The game folds up and double as a box for components.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Über den goldenen Steig
description:
Game simulates the historian routes of the salt transport around the year of 1500.

Object of the game is to collect the components for a historical "Säumer-Zug" (salt transporting caravan) with horses, riders, accompanying soldiers and/or mercenaries to encounter the dangers of the voyage.
In the meantime you have to mine salt and to acquire food for your caravan.
If you think the time is right you begin your dangerous way from the Bavarian Woods to the equally dark Bohemian Forests in order to reach the Czech capitol of Prag the first and to achieve the highest prices for your salt.

The game is of outstanding component quality.
A wooden box, where the lid acts as one of 6 wooden game boards, 3 different sorts of metal coins, real crystals, small salt cans and other heavy metal game pieces (horseshoes, pawns etc.)are a joy to behold.

The game is a project of the profession schools of the German and Czech border regions Waldkirchen and Susice.

It is manufactured by special order only, delivery time over 6 months, as nearly every game component is hand-made.

Educational aspect is served as a Czech-German dictionary comes with the game as well as a historical booklet describing salt-mining and transporting of the time being.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Winning Touch
description:
"A new exciting arithmetic fun game for all the family"

This very unusual multiplication game uses numbered tiles and a placement grid. The strategy is similar to Blokus... players use the tiles to match a multiplication fact BUT they must place each correct answer in a square touching another tile. The first player to empty his/her tile rack wins.

Includes board, four wooden racks, tiles, rules, and a vintage ad flier from the company.

(c)1962 Educational Fun Games P.O. Box 56 Winnetka, IL

name: Angleside School Adventure: A Measurement Game
description: Players explore geometry and measurement as they move around the game board (representing a round school) using a built-in compass. Game cards direct players to measure, compare and categorize angles. Players roll the die to move, draw a card if they land on a question space, and use the built-in compass to find the answer. The winner is the first player to make it to the bus stop.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Math, Number

name: Kuckucksei
description:
Content: 7 nests out of natural material, 1 color die, many colored wooden eggs

5 different games may be played with the material:
"Kuckuck, Kuckuck", "Schlafender Kuckuck", "Welche Hand?", "Hände unterm Tuch" and "Grün für den Kuckuck" (cooperative)

name: Mein erstes Naturspiel: Woher kommt mein Essen?
description:
Contents: 35 picture cards, 7 wooden stones

Bread, cheese, honey, rice, sugar, chocolate and apple juice - you ate and drank those food before. Do you know how those foods are produced?
All 35 picture cards are laid face down on the table. Now everyone tries to find the cards of each food ranked rank from 1-5 and then lay them down face up near the correct wooden play stone. The player who lays down the last card in a row earns the stone. The most stones determines the winner.

name: Garten Kunterbunt
description:
Content: 16 wooden tiles, 30 carrots

Two game ideas tell us how home fruit and vegetables look like and how it is called.

Game 1: Garten Kunterbunt: He who knows where the garden fruit grow and he who can react very fast, collects the most carrots and wins the game.

Game 2: Mein Bupfel ist: He who guesses which fruit is chosen by another child will get a carrot as his/her earnings.

name: Bump 'N' Run
description:
Bump 'N' Run - the Extreme Auto Racing Game!

NASCAR Fans get ready...Bump 'N' Run is a fast paced game that brings the excitement of auto racing right into your living room!

All the standard rules of racing apply: First you race for poll position. Then when the green flag goes down, your off around the track racing 10 laps to the finish line. On the way you will encounter caution flags, oil on the track, and maybe even get into a crash or two. Pit stops and a Mandatory Caution are sure to add even more suspense to the race. Though you may be the first to cross the finish line, you haven't won Bump & Run until your vehicle passes inspection!

name: Four Crossings of the Chishui River
description:
This wargame is the second in the Oriental Flagship Company's "Red Memories" series. (The Nanchang Rebellion is the first in the series.) The game is a simulation of a famous campaign in the Chinese Civil War. The player controlling the Communist units deploys and moves secretly on a small magnetic board, while the Kuomintang player's units are visible, though face down, on the main board.

The game's Chinese name is 四渡赤水。
publishers: Oriental Flagship (BEIJING) International Technology CO., LTD

name: The Pony Game
description:
(from the rulebook)
The Pony Game is like Monopoly. Instead of buying property, houses and hotels, the setting is the world of horses. You can own, rent, buy and sell stables and horses.

Contents
money
40 quiz cards
40 horse documents
40 horse labels
4 stable documents
4 playing pieces
2 dice

name: El Gran Comercio Ripley
description:
It’s a Monopoly kind of game, but featuring stores from different brands present in Chile instead of Streets.
Also, the fortune cards are in the shape of Ripley Store Credit Card
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Gulliver's Travels
description:
No. 293 in Piatnik's line of card games, the cards contain scenes and passages from Jonathan Swift's novel, Gulliver's Travels. The game consists of 36 game cards plus one card with the rules: 20 of the cards deal with Gulliver's journey to Lilliput, and the other 16 to Brobdingnag.

The cards are illustrated on one side, with the relevant passage from the novel on the back. The cards are marked with numbers from 1-9 and letters from a-d: 1a, 1b, 1c, 1d, 2a, etc. Every four cards with the same number are a set. The story is told sequentially from card to card, obviously heavily abbreviated.

The game is a simple "Go Fish" variant, but oddly enough they recommend gambling when playing the game! ("A pool of counters formed at the start pays an agreed bonus to the player with the most fours. A stipulated fine may be paid to the player who is misinformed about a card.") The game does not include any "counters" ...

The cards are completely in English, despite being made in Austria.

name: Cricket
description: Cricket as produced by Panther Enterprises in Sri Lanka is a simple re-theming of Snakes and ladders. Instead of snakes, however, there are squares for "bowled" and "stumped." Instead of ladders, the player may land on a "sixer" or "boundary" square and advance that number of "runs." Otherwise, it is a simple roll and move game.

name: Backaro
description:
From game's manual:

"Backaro was inspired by the thousand year old classic Backgammon and is played in a similar manner but with a few marked differences. The name Backaro means as much as 'back in the round'. The players have to bring their discs back into their designated area, in order to bear them off. For experienced Backgammon players there is a set of quick rules."
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Royals Trivia Board Game
description: 1,200 questions about the Monarchy from the past, present and from fact to fiction.

name: Steamwork Arena
description:
Steamwork Arena is a quick playing, diceless, customizable, miniature-based fighting game. You're the pilot of a steamwork mecha in an arena battle with one or more other mecha. During play, you move your mecha's miniature around an un-gridded playing area, attacking and being attacked by your opponent(s).

Here's the big gimmick: You have a special card for your mecha. This card is called a template. Your template keeps track of your health. It also keeps track of which one of 5 modes you're in. Your mode dictates your attack, defense, energy, movement, and the range of your ranged attacks. During play, you'll shift from mode to mode as your needs change. As you take damage, modes will "shut down" and become unavailable to you. You win the game by dealing enough damage to your opponent(s) to shut down all of their modes.

Here's the small gimmick: There are no dice. During play, you'll spend energy to attack and defend. To do this, you hide energy tokens in your hands and your opponent gets to pick a hand. The number of tokens in the selected hand determines how strong your attack or defense is. All tokens in both hands get spent.
