This "pick-a-hand" mechanic encourages bluffing and strategic play that's atypical for miniature games like this.

Steamwork Arena is a game for two to four players, although you could probably play it with more. Steamwork Arena uses miniatures, a large flat surface, small tokens, custom templates, and paper clips. A two-player game takes about 20 minutes to play. Steamwork Arena is appropriate for Ages 12 and up.

http://www.invisible-city.com/play/474
categories: Bluffing, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing

name: Have Chariot Will Race
description:
These rules allow quick and fun chariot racing involving two or more chariots. Historically the Romans usually raced 4, 8 or 12 chariots.
Each player controls one or more units. A unit can be a chariot OR a driver that survived a crashed chariot.
During a turn each player moves their unit one at a time in the following order decided by track position: The current race leading unit moves first each turn. If more than 1 unit is in the same row, then dice to decide the order of movement for the units in that row. Highest roll wins; re-rolling ties. If the leading chariot has crashed and the driver survived, it is still considered the leading unit until overtaken by another chariot or driver. The next to move is the unit in the next closest row (not lane), and so on. Dice for units in the same row as above. If a unit has been lapped, its physical position on the track behind the race leader at the start of that turn counts for movement order, not the number of laps completed.
Crashed chariots do not move voluntarily, but may move as the outcome of a collision (see COLLISIONS). Collisions are resolved at the time they occur and any outcome moves applied, before a unit completes a move. For curves, determine the unit in front by comparing front lines of each space when extended sideways.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Das Giftmüll-Spiel
description: Das Giftmüll-Spiel' was inspired by the Seveso toxic waste disaster in 1976. In a co-operative gameplay the players try to prevent toxic waste transports to reach their destination.
publishers: Institut für ökologische Forschung und Bildung e.V, Ökotopia

name: Huevopolis
description: It’s a Monopoly kind of game, but featuring the characters of Huevo Cartoon
categories: Dice, Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Flush!  The All-American Tax Game
description:
Flush! is a Clinton-era satirical trivia game about taxes and the IRS. Players roll and move along the board, which features caricatures of many of the most recognizable political figures of the early '90s (apparently, images of the board were sold as posters before publication of the game). Depending on the space, players pay taxes, fees, or penalties, answer questions in the categories of Tax & Trivia, Waste, and Pork, flush money down the toilet in the center of the board when they draw an Audit card, and occasionally receive Handouts from the other players.

The winner is the person retaining the most money after everyone has landed in the Poor House.

name: Doodlebops Card Game
description: Card game based on the children's television show, "The Doodlebops." Cards feature pictures of Doodlebop characters, and game includes rule sets for variations of games of memory, charades, and "Don't Pull the Rope."

name: Hex CCG
description:
A fan-created CCG set in the world of the Hex TV show, in which players try to either corrupt Medenham School, using main characters such as Azazeal, Jo Watkins, and Malachi, or try to resist the evil forces, using characters such as Cassandra 'Cassie' Hughes, Thelma Bates, and Ella Dee.

The players start at 10 corruption, and the first to reach either 0 corruption or 20 corruption wins. Players gain/lose corruption via combat and reaching or opposing purposes.

While the game's Buffy CCG roots can clearly be seen, there are many differences. The main ones being:

Each character has six stats: fighting ability, intelligence, persuasion, mysticism, integrity and charm.
The purposes have both good and evil sides, so both players can attempt them, regardless of their side.
The turn structure is much less organized, as players play cards, move characters, and resolve actions all in the same phase, instead of having move, resource, combat and end steps.
Cards have a corruption cost, so the more powerful cards can only be played later in the game, and only by players of that alignment.


The initial set has 482 cards, of the following types: starting effects, characters, items, skills, plans, events, locations and purposes.

name: Go=Figure "The ADDING and SUBTRACTING GAME"
description:
Go=Figure is a basic Addition and Subtraction game for Kindergarten through 2nd Grade.

Go=Figure is designed to reinforce addition and subtraction and co-operation skills by having Players make correct equations.


Go= Figure Components:

44 Number cards
1 Equal card
1 Spinner


2 ways to win:

"Everyone is a Winner” - The game is over when each Player has played all their cards.

“Individual Winner” - The game is over when the first Player has played all their cards.

name: Ultragammon
description:
Synopsis from the patent:
"A backgammon board game for two, three or four players wherein the movement spaces are positioned in the form of a cross. Each of the players is given 15 stones which they must move around the board according to rules which are similar to those used in conventional backgammon. The stones of each player are of a color different from the stones of the other players."

The rules include 6 new games that can be played on the 4-player backgammon board: Warm Up, Stacked, Ultracross, Heavy Traffic (4 dice per player), Itche and Ultra-Wars.

name: Master of Golf
description:
Masters of Golf is a golf simulation game. It is based on the rules of golf.

The players use a personal percentage table to determine which club to select. A turn on a wheel determines the accuracy of the hit. Dice determine the direction of flight. If the hit was unsuccessful (for example the ball is possibly out of bounce) an action/outcome card is drafted and the resulting action/outcome is taken (actions/outcomes are based on the rules of golf). A pion marks the place of the ball.

There are 9 boards for 9 holes, and the small game/putting is simulated on a separate board. The players can use their own golf statistics to make up their own tables for use in the game. All variants of golf can be played (stableford, strokeplay, matchplay, foursome, fourball, skins)

Home Page: http://www.masterofgolf.nl/
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Das Wildschweinspiel
description:
Rare Perlhuhn tube game whose title simply means "game with boars".

In this fast tactical and bluffing game with asymmetric setup one player plays the hunters while the other acts as boar trying to out-maneuver his opponent.

The boar wins when it reaches a (secret) target spot on the board while the hunters win when they capture the boar trying to escape.

The playing pieces are massive metal cubes and tubes - the included wooden boars should only "be used as a giveaway" (quoting the instructions...!)

name: Adsubmuldi
description:
Adsubmuldi is a self-described checkers variant utilizing pieces with numerals on the undersides of the pieces. Apparently its name was derived thus: ADdition, SUBtraction, MULtiplication, DIvision.

Included with the game are instructions for two variants, Adsubmuldi and Adsubmuldi Fractions.

Here is a quote from its introduction:
"These two series of games are based on the game of checkers, and are played on a standard checkerboard with checker-like pieces. The basic rules of checkers also apply. Although two players normally oppose each other, the games can be played by one person opposing himself or by four players pairing up and playing as partners.

The object of the games is to accumulate the most points by solving correctly the larger number of addition, subtraction, multiplication, or division problems. Adsubmuldi is designed to reinforce these skills with whole numbers, and Adsubmuldi Fractions does the same with fractions and mixed numbers.

The game ends, as in regular checkers, when all the playing pieces belonging to one of the players have been captured. However, the winner of the game is the player with the most points, even if he is the one who lost all the playing pieces."

name: Tickles the Turtle
description: Players spin the turtle to make Tickles giggle, and his tail tells how many foam feathers to stuff into his tummy. The excitement builds as Tickles giggles more and more. And then POP! If his shell pops off on your turn, you win!

name: Villa Medicea
description:
Three components make a beautiful wooden mansion. The three parts standing for a single game each:
In the basement its a horse racing game (simple roll & move)
The intermediate part is a dexterity game, a kind of bowling using a spinner
The top part is a solitary dexterity maze

Everything is handmade and its a very big game. As a result the complete game costs about 3000 EUR.

name: Shake-A-Leg Game
description:
A large number of small plastic yellow chips are placed inside a large red plastic shoe which has two circular holes on each side. A small number of chips differ from the majority and cause a particular action to occur should they be shaken from the shoe during a player's turn.

A turn consists of shaking the shoe for as long as it takes a marble to come to rest in the small parabolic bowl included with the game. The first player to collect 20 'normal' chips is the winner.

name: All Grown Up
description:
This game was distributed to new VW Jetta owners as a perk. The concept is a competition among the new owner's friends to be the first to have a chance to drive his/her new Jetta. The new owner puts the key at the end of the track, and the first player to get there gets to drive it.
The theme is a tongue-in-cheek look at what it means to be an adult. The movement is spinner-based, with certain spaces causing the player to move forward or backward an additional amount based on text on the board or on drawn cards.

name: Poltawa
description:
Originally published in Panzerfaust Magazine Volume 5 #5 in September 1970 (Very Rare!!!!),Poltawa a game covering the 18th Century battle between the Swedes and the Russians on June 28, 1709 designed by Chris Johnson.

These early issues of Panzerfaust were mimeographed and all the components were printed in the magazine, more of a game kit.

You could not actually use the original components without destroying parts of the magazine that were on the other side of the page, in some cases components of the the game - ie maps and counters printed on the reverse side of the rules.

The following components are all high quality color photocopies from the original magazine, note that there is some yellowing that printed through. The 2.5-pages of rules are in excellent condition (relies heavily on AH classic rules such as Waterloo) and include the historical orders of battle. The map is in three colors - red, green & purple - on four 8.5" X 11" sheets copied onto buff color paper. The counters are on one unmounted sheet printed in two colors, red and the all to familiar purple. The time record track is with the counters.

Hard-to-find piece of wargame history.

name: G.I. Joe Combat Infantry Game
description: Game comes from Hassenfeld Bros. the precursor of Hasbro. The box cover states that the object of the game is to "Help G.I.Joe knock out the enemy machine gun nest. Game comes with 16 pawns and some game cards. From Games Gone By.

name: Ensign O'Toole  U.S.S. Appleby Game
description:
Based on the '60s TV show "Ensign O'Toole" which starred Dean Jones.

Object of game: To be the first player to travel from the starting place along the progression path to the finish space and thus becomes the winner.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Nautical, World War II

name: Stagecoach West Adventure Game
description:
Based on the classic but short-lived television show of the same name.

Object of game: Luke Parry and his cowboys at the Bar-X Ranch are battling an outlaw gang of cattle rustlers for controls of the range. Each side is equally matched. The first side to capture all the enemy’s men or reach the enemy’s “Finish Space” with 2 men is the winner, but it takes luck, pluck and skill to win.
categories: American West, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Battlez FMX Edition
description:
Battlez FMX is an action sports based collectible card & dice game, featuring Freestyle Motocross superstar Brian Deegan, along with Metal Mulisha team members Todd Potter & Jeremy Lusk.

Battlez FMX allows you to battle it out as if in a real freestyle MX
competition, playing as your favorite FMX rider. Score or take points away from your opponent by matching dice combinations on the cards and executing tricks like Kiss of Death's, BackFlip's, Cliffhangers, Rock Solids and more. First player to 100 points wins.

In addition, there are specialty cards such as the Rockstar Energy Drink Boost Card allowing you to roll all 3 dice at once, the Stop Card allowing you to stop your opponent from playing the same card repeatedly and the First Aid Card, immediately subtracting 50 points from your opponent.
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Sport Of Kings Challenge
description:
Sport Of Kings Challenge: The Horse Racing Quiz Game

"4400 questions to entertain followers of the world's #1 spectator sport!"

"A party game! A study guide! A nostalgia trip!"

This horse racing trivia game includes a colorful race track board, 6 plastic horses, 6 plastic tokens, hundreds of trivia question cards, a die, and 6 category cards.

Players answer equine trivia questions as they move their horses around the track.

(c)1986 Kuriakos Inc.

name: Europe Marches
description: A 1939 wargame that is very rare and (if you can find it) very expensive. The board features a very colorful map of Europe, with France, Italy, Germany, and England's player areas in the corners of the board.

name: Irány a játszótér!
description:
"Irány a játszótér!" means "Let's go to the playground!".
This is a classic Hungarian children's game from the mid 1980s.
It's a simple roll and move game where you have to visit all the games in a playground.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Manók tánca
description:
Classic Hungarian game from the mid 1980s.
The title in English is "Dance of the Dwarves".

Each players get 4 dwarves in his/her color, and places them in their start places at the middle of the board.
Your goal is to lead your people around the board to the home place of your color with a simple roll and move mechanic.
The catch is that all players' meeples looks exactly like the same (check pictures), because your color is shows only at the bottom of your meeples, so when you're on the move you can easily mix up your people with other players' people. You can check your meeples only at the home site.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Det nya Europa
description: A game published and distributed 1994 by the YES-side during the European Union-referendum in Sweden. Players shall roll the dice and move and then learn about the "new" and the "old" Europe.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Buster Brown Hurdle Race Game
description: This is a rare children's game, probably published in the early 1900s. The cover features some children and animals jumping over hurdles. The board has a track circling the outside of the board with a picture of a band playing on the green interior of the track. Also on the interior of the track are four cheering adults, a tepee, and a table set for dinner (with lobster being served).

name: Old Mother Hubbard
description: Actually a spin and move game from Cadaco from 1954. The game includes a pictorial peg board, a Mother Hubbard spinner and 16 wooden pegs (4 each in 4 different colors)

name: Monkey's Uncle
description: Monkey's Uncle from Transogram uses a timer, a spinner and a series of mats that have different tasks that need to be accomplished before the timer runs out. Things like Make a Sound, Build a Tower, Guess Who, Guess What are on cards that are drawn at random and must be accomplished in order to score points. You spin the spinner move to the color mat matching that spin and then try to accomplish the designated task before the timer runs out.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Zecken Burger
description:
From the publisher:

"Nasty ticks in big burgers

Tasty hamburger ingredients are placed on the table. Each player gets four ingredients on his hand and tries to build delicious burgers which get high scores. But hey, what's that? There's a tick between the ingredients. Try to get rid of it as fast as possible. Put it in a burger and hope that no one notices. Fortunately you also can put it in an opponent's burger. But he may give you his burger then and you mustn't refuse that nice 'gift'.
Bluff: Place your ingredients face-down on the table. So no one knows if it's cheese, salad, onions or a little tick. When your opponent gives you that burger, you'll get extra-score. Find the right strategy and the right face-expression to convince your opponents. When the cards are turned face-up, it's getting funny. Tick-Burger is a funny mixture of strategy, chance and bluff for the whole family."

name: Killing Machine: Special Forces Supplement
description:
The Killing Machine: Special Forces Supplement contains additional advanced rules for the Killing Machine miniatures wargame.

This supplement introduces:
Support Fire: On- and off-table support, and Forward Observers
Specialist Troop Types: Special Forces Elite Troops; Snipers; Assault Engineers
Insertion Techniques
New Equipment: Sneaksuits; LAWs; Robot Sentry-Guns

name: 15 Minutes Of Fame
description:
From the publisher:

"Are you ready for your 15 Minutes of Fame?
Test your wit and stretch your imagination as creatively-crafted clues are combined to reveal famous secret identities!

When you have the spotlight, how will you reveal your secret identity? You've picked....Arnold Schwarzenegger! Your first challenger might ask, "If you were a food, what type of food would you be?" Your answer could be, "mussels", or, "Weiner schnitzel", or even, "protein drink." The next question might be, "....what type of transportation would you be?" Your answer? How about, "a tank" or "Hummer." Your clues are limited only by your imagination!
Little by little, clue by clue, other players begin to develop a sense of your identity. 15 Minutes of Fame isn't always easy, but it's always fun, sometimes outrageous, frequently challenging and quite surprising!
It even includes a few customizable cards for personalized fun! Who knows where this will take you?"

name: Bitmoor
description:
Content: board, 10 pawns, 2 dice

This is the exciting race of two "Bit-Schaften" of 5 bits each across the Bitmoor.
The aim of the game is to reach the opposite side with all 5 bits despite all obstacles and put them together in a row.

name: Parallel Worlds
description:
The game is a 2 to 4 player trick-taking card game using a deck of 25 custom cards.

From the publisher's website:
Parallel Worlds has a unique playing deck consisting of 25 cards, made up of four 6 card suits belonging to the elements Earth, Air, Fire and Water, plus a Wild card. Each of the suits is also represented by a "House" name that originates from the 1,000's of planets spread throughout space and time.

New Houses will be made available for collection and integration into any starter deck, enabling every player to customize their own deck to their personal taste. Before play commences each player can then select a complete 6 card suit from their own customized deck to represent them as "Temporal Adjuster" within the game.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Science Fiction

name: Big Buck Deer Hunt
description:
A two to four player game where one player is the "buck."
Players role dice in order to move through the forest in search special places on the board where there will be an opportunity to shoot the buck.
Along the way the hunters will encounter obstacles such as, "Mauled by a bear go back to camp and start over," or "Sprayed by a skunk go back to camp to change clothes"
The hunters win when on of them successfully kills the buck.
The Buck wins by "Must go to feeding station dot (upper center) and through no trespassing zone (upper right), any order, and then return to deer refuge dot (lower left).
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Pima Indian Stick Game
description: This stick game is a traditional game of the Pima Indians of the southwestern part of the US. The 4 sticks each have a pattern indicating a movement option around the track, which is a square with 4 "spaces" on each side. The sticks are cast in the air, and the way they fall determines which movement options the player has for that turn. Basic general rules about movement add some strategy to the order in which these movement options are taken. The first player to go around the track 3 times is the winner.

name: That 70's Show Spin the Bottle Game
description: "That 70's Show" Spin the Bottle Game was a promotional game released to FOX television affiliates in 2002. It contains a board with cast member's faces on which to spin the bottle, along with a bottle of orange Crush bearing a special "That 70's Show" bottle label.
categories: Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Bush Whacked
description: Players make their way around the board by facing three challenges: Bush Trivia (Test your knowledge of America's 43rd president), Bushisms (Is it a real quote or a fake quote), and Bushwhacks (These make you go backwards). The first player to make their way around the board (in whichever direction) and successfully answers a trivia or bushism challenge wins the game

name: Lady Bug Fly-a-Way
description:
First you attach a plain balloon to a nozzle inside a plastic flower. Another flower device acts as a spinner on the top and an air pump underneath. Players spin, count the number of ladybugs showing on the spinner, and then pump it that many times. Each turn inflates the balloon until at a certain point, the balloon is full and suddenly flies off. The one who does this is the winner.

Completely luck-based game from Marx Toys, known for making games involving novelty plastic devices. This particular game is under their label "The Little Entertainers: First Games for the Very Young." The game states ages 4-8.

name: Drift
description:
A tactical car-racing game for up to 5 players without any luck!
Learn to control your cars by following the best line and keeping an eye on your opponents. The mecanics are quite similar to Bolide in how you accelerate and brake the cars.

Comes in an opaque yellow tube with a leatherette playing board.

name: Team Enduro Motorcycle Race Game
description:
In this roll and move game each player controls a team of three motorcycles that enter a race in intervals. Once more than one team motorcycle is on the trail, players choose which one to move forward. However, motorcycles cannot pass others on the same team. Along the trail motorcycles can encounter breakdowns, various natural barriers, pile-ups and shortcuts. The first player to get all three motorcycles to the finish line wins.

Equipment:
Game board
Dice
Four sets of three motorcycles (each a different color)
Four color-coded breakdown counters (for tracking lost turns for each motorcycle)
Deck of breakdown cards

name: Hannah Montana CD Board Game
description:
Get Miley to the concert & Hannah up on stage by collecting stuff that's the "best of both of her worlds."

Objective: Collect 6 Concert cards and be first to the Stage. Your fans are waiting.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Trivia
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Singing

name: The Cheetah Girls CD Board Game
description:
The Fierce Foursome have Growl Power. They're an unbeatable team on and off the stage. Now it's time for you to show your spots with your BFF's! It will be easy-breezy fun for all of you.

Objective: The Cheetah Girls are challenging you and your friends to collect picture cards of them. The first player to get 4 different Cheetah Girl cards and return home to her Center Star wins the game.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Trivia
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Singing

name: Pirate's Bounty
description: Objective: Be the first player to reach the treasure. A simple roll and move game with a few action cards and a short cut. Art and rules signify it as a game for small children.

name: Satisfaction!
description: The object is to be the first player to circle the board and land on the red home lens when it is lit.

name: Mickey Mouse Moving Day Game
description: Object of the Game: Mickey Mouse is moving and all his friends are pitching in to help. Give Mickey a hand and load your van. The first player to load their van is the winner.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Arkanum
description:
Content: 1 see saw, 21 balls in a wooden box

By adding balls onto the see saw and pushing down the upper part the balls roll into a certain pattern which earns points to win.

name: Corporate Battles
description:
This game was distributed as an item promoting recruitment for the Republic of Singapore Navy. It was sent in the mail to young people who were completing school and starting working life.

The game actually has two games in one: one version is set in the corporate world, where landing on a brown nose, licked boot or kissed butt square sends your briefcase piece forward, but blackmail, back stab and tie squares send you back. The other is set in the Navy and landing on medal, badge of rank or targeted submarine squares are advantageous, and enemy subs, mines and torpedoes are bad.

Fundamentally, the games are Snakes-and-Ladder clones, but with themes contrasting a career in the navy with working in an office.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Wild FIRE: Legend of the Ryukage – Card Battle Game
description:
Based on the events described in the first three chapters of "Wild FIRE: Legend of the Ryukage - Book 1, Vol. 1", this Turn-Based/ Card Battle style game pits the five mysterious Ryukage clans (with powers based on the 5 elements of Fire, Water, Wind, Earth and Sand) against one another for the purpose of defeating the sinister 'Gold Clan' in order to protect the powerful ‘Star Heart’ orb from falling into the hands of a ruthless evil capable of destroying the delicate balance of space/ time itself.

The game comes complete with the following:

A4 sized laminated playing board (x1)
1 deck of playing cards ( 185 card set hand-made)
Game Play Manual (printed version - download also


available)

2 playing dice (only 1 is needed to play, the other is a


spare)

20 colored playing stones (representing each clan)


Game mechanics are deigned to be simple, with each player moving through the game board by rolling dice in an attempt to get to the center of the board so that they can battle the Gold Clan. However, getting to the center of the board is not enough.

In order to beat the Gold Clan, players must "power up" along the way by defending their own clan`s territory, crossing over into other clans` territories via "cross-over points" and Card Battling against rival clan members to collect their cards in order to increase their energy (life) points and gain much higher level "Combo Attacks" which they will use to defeat the Gold Clan and wipe out any of the menacing Kuragami Demons lurking about along the way.

Victory is obtained only when one player enters the final arena and defeats the Gold Clan.

This game can be played by 1~5 players on a single game board. Players with multiple game boards can network with each other following a special set of “Clan Battle” in which the primary objective is simply to eradicate the remaining 4 clans. (Recommended for up to 3 game boards and 15 players.)
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Mature / Adult, Novel-based, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Euromedia
description: A simple roll-and-move game that requires the players to move around a representation of Europe. The object is to acquire three media campaigns in each country, trading with each other to complete your fledgling empire. The coloured playing pieces are drawn randomly at the beginning of the game, and will determine what market you must play to acquire: Mass Market; Professionals; Mothers; or Youth.

name: Surfie Joe and the Weirdo Board Riders
description:
From the box:

"Surfie Joe and the Weirdo Board Riders" is a game for up to 4 players of all ages.

The object of the game is to score top World Championship points in the greatest ever fun-packed surf board riding contest.

The game is played for any agreed number of rides to see who wins the WORLD CHAMPIONSHIP BOARD RIDING CONTEST.

Rides commence at the bottom of the board. Movement is determined by whatever directions appear on the particular card drawn each turn and the directions printed on the board. Points awarded for a ride are determined by the numerical value printed on the square where the ride finishes, located at the top of the game board.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Slap-Happy Game
description:
"Slap-stick fun for slap-happy players."

From the box:

It's a SLAP HAPPY Game chock full of lightning-fast reflex action. There are kooky SLAPPERS and 2 sets of whacky character cards; one ROUND, the other RECTANGULAR. The ROUNDS are spread out face up and the RECTANGLES are stacked face down. As soon as one rectangular card is turned up, the wild action starts. SLAPPERS fly... everyone trying to "slap" a matching ROUND CARD. The SLAPPER that picks up the right ROUND CARD gets to keep it. The player with the sharpest eye AND the quickest hand will get the most ROUND CARDS and be the slap-happiest winner!

name: Script-tionary
description:
Scriptionary a.k.a. Script-tionary

(c)1996 Bible Games Company

A religious game that combines elements of Pictionary and Charades. Designed for two teams (a minimum of four people are needed) of players who respond to Biblical clues from both the Old Testament and the New Testament. The scripture cards include information about a person, place, thing, concept, or event mentioned in the Bible.

Includes cards, two boards, two pens, timer, spinner, rules, and scoring tokens.

Ages 10 and up.

name: Communion Of Saints
description:
Communion Of Saints -- A Roman Catholic Board Game

This game is designed to illustrate some basic concepts of the Roman catholic faith.

In this religion game players move from birth to death as they learn about Catholic saints, church sacraments, the power of prayer, and the penalty for sins.

Includes a colorful board, beautifully illustrated saint cards printed in Italy, tokens, sacrament cards, prayer cards, sin cards, and rules.

name: Slipp'ry Spoons Game
description:
From the box:

"Spin the top, get 3-in-a-row. Grab the spoons to win the show!"

A ten-sided top determines the action on each turn. The faces on the top have the numbers 1-9 and there is also a wild face, represented by crossed spoons. Each player has their own unique 3x3 'bingo' grid with the numbers 1-9 on the game board which must be completed in a tic-tac-toe manner. Above this grid is the word 'SPOON'. A number of spoons are placed on the game board, equal to one less than the number of players.

The top is spun. Players cover the particular number spun with a small cardboard disc. If an appropriate number is spun that will complete a line of any player's grid, all players must grab for the spoons. The player missing out covers one of the letters on 'SPOON'.

Bingo grids are cleared, the spoons are replaced and another round commences. When a player completely covers 'SPOON' they are eliminated. The last remaining player is the winner.

name: 1 x 1: Spiel
description:
Content:
board, 10 math-cards (multiply), 100 residents, 10 substitute pawns, 10 keys

In this game math basics must be solved and as a result houses are occupied. The player with the most points for his houses wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math

name: Fun Can
description:
Content:
can with two dice in a window

With this can there can be played several dice games which are described outside. The can is shaken, and the both dice appear in two small windows.

name: Red Desert
description:
In the late spring of 1939, Japanese and Soviet armies skirmished over an insignificant piece of ground along the Khalkin-Gol River, on the border between the Soviet client state of Mongolia and Japan's puppet empire of Manchuria. Both sides threw in more and more troops until by late August, each had committed entire armies. By the time a cease-fire took effect in mid-September, the Soviets had lost over 17,000 men and the Japanese a staggering 45,000, over half of those committed.

Red Desert portrays these battles at a scale of two kilometers per hex. Units are mostly battalions, with some companies and small regiments. Units are rated for attack, defense, movement, morale and armor strength; artillery units can provide offensive or defensive support.

Red Desert uses a variant of the Chaos game system used Winter Fury and Army of Lappland to portray these battles at a scale of two kilometers per hex.

Components:

840 1/2-inch playing pieces
One map


(source: Avalanche Press website and user's description)

name: The Graduate
description: As the instructions say this game "take players down the college trail." The game is simple roll and move with a little twist of having to roll a special die at semester finals time to figure out your GPA. In the beginning your first rolls will determine if you want to go Greek or not, as well as paying tuition, eventual you land on a major and then as you go, you face different paths to take and if you want a bachelors, masters or doctorate. Each major has a different pay rating and is of course dependent on your level of degree. You also earn points for each semester according to GPA and there is a scale as to how much you make. To win you have to graduate and the game ends with everyone graduating and the winner is the one with the most money. If you reach graduation first don't worry you continue to collect money each round without having to do anything. Also the game was distributed in a long tube and the game board is vinyl that rolls up nicely.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Monopolorange
description: The classic real estate game set within a company: Telephone Provider Orange. Buy departments, FTE's, managers and if all goes wrong: file for bankruptcy. Instead of going to jail, you have to go to security, because you forgot your badge.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: The Adventures of Ko the Koala
description:
Very simple roll-and-move game for younger children with an Australian theme.

Players spin the spinner and move the indicated number of spaces along the bush track, obeying any instructions written on the space landed on. The first player to reach Mother Koala at home by exact count is the winner.

name: Burg Schreckenstein
description:
Content:
board, 1 castle wall, 4 knights, 1 ghost, 2 color dice

The players are looking for a treasure which is said to be located in a castle. Kunibert, the ghost, tries to prevent them finding the treasure. The first player who can outwit the ghost and finds the treasure wins

name: Space Grind
description: Being updated - look back soon for more information.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Tippy Teepee Game
description:
From the box:

'DRAW THE STRAWS ONE BY ONE
WHEN THE TEEPEE FALLS, THE GAME IS DONE'

The game comes in a distinctive and unique box, shaped like an elongated square pyramid.

A number of 16" long, brightly colored plastic sticks are placed in a plastic ring 1" high & 1" in diameter and fanned at the base to form a teepee structure. Players remove one stick from the structure each turn. Sticks are removed by color group until the structure collapses, eliminating the player who removed that stick from the game.

The teepee is set back up and play continues in this fashion until all players except one have been eliminated. The player remaining wins the game.

name: Finesse
description:
Finesse uses a standard deck of cards and a game board that features a tableau for each of the four card suits. Each tableau has specific spaces for ranks 2 through king, as well as eight suited spaces below. Each player has 6 pawns in their color.

From the box:
Maneuver 3 of your 6 pieces into opposing player's back row, while defending your own, using piece movement and playing cards. First player to score 3 times wins. An intriguing game of skill and alertness.

name: CityProGame Dortmund
description:
Using the detailed street map of Dortmund, which is set out in four colors, each player is given five companies to be established in the city as close to the center as possible.

Once a company is established on the map, the corresponding four 'places worth seeing' are revealed, so familiarizing players with the sights of the city.

Contents: 80 cards, 8 counters, 3 dice, rules and city information.

name: Insurgency
description: Insurgency covers the first two years in Iraq following the ground campaign in 2003, as the American-led Coalition attempts to quell armed Iraqi resistance. American, British and multi-national military units are presented on a brigade level. Insurgency combines stratagems, a hexagonal grid map, and a unique city grid system to highlight the importance of urban centers in Iraqi guerrilla uprising. The Coalition player can invest resources in troop increases, infrastructure rebuilding or act to reach political solutions. Meanwhile, the Insurgent player seeks to unify guerrilla factions, while waging a war of attrition on Coalition forces. Each game play is unpredictable, and explores numerous scenarios with the introduction of randomly-drawn stratagems.

name: Girlfriends' Intuition
description:
From the Publisher:

The development of Girlfriends’ Intuition was inspired by the fact that women love to get together to relax, play games, chat about what is going on in their lives, and share their past experiences. The search for a truly fun game to play at such gatherings was unsuccessful and the creation of Girlfriends’ Intuition began....

Girlfriends’ Intuition is a question and answer game that is played on a casual but mildly competitive basis. It is designed to spark conversation and learn fun facts about the women in the group. The questions and responses will definitely stress your laughing muscles and everyone will have a fabulous time

Play The Game. . . .

Girlfriends’ Intuition is designed for team play - two players to a team. Use your intuition to correctly guess the answers that your teammate or opponents have given to hilarious, intimate, and everyday questions that are drawn from two decks of question cards. The Girls Just Wanna Know questions will have you rolling on the floor with laughter, as will the Whisper Bonus questions, but shhh.....we can’t tell you what they are about!

name: Nelson's Victory: The Royal Navy at War, 1793-1805
description:
Nelson's Victory will cover the Anglo-French naval struggle from the French Revolution through to Battle of Trafalgar.

The game will combining elements of SPI's "CA," Avalon HIll's "War at Sea" and XTR's "Red Sky Morning." The map will cover from the Caribbean to the eastern Mediterranean. Combat will use an evolution of "War at Sea's" and "CA's" simple systems, with modifications to account for the tactics of the age of sail. Annual game turns are driven by "Red Sky Morning's" system of impulses that shift unpredictably from player to player, depicting the uncertainties of the era's naval warfare.

Three large-size counter sheets (528) will depict the ships-of-the-line (64 guns and up) of 11 navies, plus a sheet of markers.

name: Peter Rabbit's Giant Picture Card Game
description:
Peter Rabbit's Giant Picture Card Game is a set-collection game similar to Go Fish or Happy Families. The deck contains 4 cards representing each of 9 Beatrix Potter characters.

The package also includes rules for playing Old Maid, Snap and Pairs with the cards.

name: A Rhyme In Time For Kids!
description:
From the rules:

A Rhyme In Time For Kids is based on the award-winning board game A Rhyme In Time. It encourages creativity and fun through the use of language skills. The Rhyme In Time For Kids card deck may be used by one or more players, ages 5 and up, and as a substitute card deck for the adult board game.

A Rhyme In Time For Kids is 2 games in 1:
1. A creative poetry game
2. A memory / matching game
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game, Word Game
publishers: Poet And Didn't Know It Co.

name: CheckOrDice
description:
Subtitled: "A Game of Points".

There was even included a button of which states: "I'm a CheckOrDice 'ER".

This has a checkerboard gameplay area of 8x8 with a separate scoring track provided off to the sides. There are some of the white squares depicted with a value, like the faces of a die, hence their being known as "Dice". Those white squares of which have no die depicted are called the "Check" squares. The black squares are never in play at all. Each player has 12 tokens, that are referred to as "tiles", with 2 smaller "markers" that players use to keep track of the score on the score track. Players move onto the "Dice", and/or jump over an opponent's pieces in order to score. The first player to amass 100 points is the winner!.

This also allows for doubling-up of the "tiles" when you have moved any to the opposite side/end of the board of "Gameplay" squares, whereupon those will score double the amounts later on then. There are also rules to extend the game if a longer duration is desired, with those being printed along the outside of the box.

Produced and published in Seattle, Washington, USA.

name: Tribble
description:
Content:
Funbox, 55 cards, double sided

Tribble is a crossword game for 2 persons or teams. The goal of the game is: To build given characters into words so that a word system is developing as you know it from a crossword puzzle.

Each player draws a card out of the box and starts to find words to connect the given characters with senseful words.
The player who has completed this goal calls "Tribble" and gets the points for each new character.

name: Gelati
description:
Content: 3 ice cream cones, 3 whipped cream, 36 wooden ice cream balls, 1 bag, 10 cards with 2 ice cream balls each,
24 cards with 3 ice cream balls each

Summer or wintertime ice cream is always fun. In this game the combination of the different numbers of ice cream balls is important. The player who has the right combination according to his cards wins the game.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Recognition, Pick-up and Deliver

name: The First of May
description:
Hooray Hooray! It’s The First of May. Outdoor f*cking starts today! And you are in the park to f*ck everyone who needs f*cking. The park is full of characters from JoCo songs. Whoever f*cks the most characters wins.

First of May is based on the Jonathan Coulton song of the same name.

name: Kipper: Where Are My Toys?
description:
Kipper -- Where are my toys?

A children's board game based on the books by Mick Inkpen.

Players move through Kipper's house and try to find all six of his missing toys.

"Strengthens color matching skills"

"Enhances hand-eye coordination & motor skills"

"Friendly game play"

Designed for players ages 3 and older.

Includes a colorful game board with spinner, tokens, chips, label sheet, storage insert, and rules.

(c)2000 Cadaco

Item # 8969
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Pepper
description:
The object of each player is to obtain the remaining cards of the families of which he happens to hold a part. When a player receives a card he must instantly say "Thank you" otherwise some one will immediately call "Pepper" and take all his cards. The fun of the game consists in securing and completing the various families, and even more particularly in the constant capturing of cards by calling "Pepper" and in the efforts of those who have lost their cards to again get into the game.

The pack is made up a number of Families, each family consisting of five cards: the MAN, his WIFE, SON, DAUGHTER and a fifth card showing an ARTICLE indicating the family.

For example, in Sir Peter's family the 5th card is a servant. Thus: The Sir Peter Peppercorn Family consists of Sir Peter, his wife, son, daughter and servant.

There are 9 sets of families.

name: Robijn een briljant spel
description: Old game by Homas where the players have two rows of (differently colored )playing pieces with different numbers that are being set up like with checkers.The purpose is to move your pieces to the opposite side of the gameboard but in doing that the numbers and different colors of the pieces play a role.

name: Gone Crabbin'
description: This board game was distributed as a press release from the McCormick & Schmick’s chain of seafood restaurants. There are two sets of "Crab Trivia" cards: one is "Fact or Fiction", the other is "Multiple Choice". The cards contain questions about crabs, for example, "Fact or Fiction: The stone crab's claws account for more than half its entire body weight." The object of the game is for the player to move their crab token all the way around the board to the end.

name: Fraction Bros. Circus
description: Educational game for teaching fractions. Players attempt to fill circles with wedge shaped pieces. Game play is a simple affair of spinning dials for numerator and denominator and inserting appropriate game pieces into any unfilled circle of the board. The player who fills a circle completely scores points. When all the circles on the board have been filled, the player with the most points is the winner.

name: Fun With Language Arts
description: Educational game for teaching language arts. Players roll die and advance around the board by answering questions in one of four categories: spelling, usage, capitalization, and punctuation.

name: Das Spiel um Herborn
description:
Content:
three times foldable board, 4 pawns, 1 die, 4 cars, 48 chips, 30 action cards

"The game of Herborn" is a marketing game similar to a economic game around stocks which was produced by a Norwegian company and was offered to German communities to promote their town.

The goal is to buy and sell companies of your own town
and get the money of other players. It is important is to watch the changing of the stock market.
Winner is the player who earns 70000 DM first.

name: The Game of Volunteer Management
description:
"The Game of Volunteer Management is a board game to help individuals who are charged with developing a new volunteer program or managing an existing program to become aware of the critical skills needed to create an effective volunteer program. It is meant to raise the important issues in a manner that is both educational and fun."

Players roll a die, move around the board, and answer questions focused around the "five key concepts" of Volunteer Management:

1. Planning and program evaluation
2. Recruitment and placement
3. Orientation and training
4. Supervision and volunteer evaluation
5. Recognition
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation, Track Movement

name: Salem Trivia
description: "So you think you know Salem? Inside are hundreds and hundreds of trivia questions about your town and area businesses." Players roll die and advance around the board by navigating through hundreds and hundreds of questions about Salem, Oregon.

name: Barncharad
description:
This game you can play as an individual or on a team.

Roll the die and the color will tell you what word you have to draw. You will get 2 points if you can guess before the time is up.

Content
150 cards
1 die with colors
1 glass timer
2 pen
4 block
rules

name: Hitch-Hikers Guide to the Eclipse
description:
In this game (subtitled "A Souvenir To Celebrate The Eclipse, Cornwall 1999") the players take the role of hitch-hikers making their way into Cornwall to view the 1999 full solar eclipse.

The game mechanics are basic; roll-and-move along a variety of routes (accurately based on the major roads in Cornwall), racing against time. Each move is a random length and takes a random time (rolled on two separate dice); the game starts with 72 hours before the eclipse - the duration of each move is deducted from each player's personal 'clock'. In the process the players also have to earn money by doing bits of casual work here and there in order to have the £50 entrance fee that admittance to the "optimum viewing site" requires for admittance. If time gets tight the players even have the opportunity to visit Merlin's Cave at Tintagel to be sent back in time after completing a task for him.

It's a strange game, probably more interesting as a curiosity/souvenir than for gameplay. The quality of components and printing is very good, although most of the graphics used in the game appear to be royalty-free clip art, along with a rather varied selection of fonts.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Veggie Land
description:
This game for very young players introduces the basics of boardgames.

Players are ladybugs flitting from vegetable to vegetable in the garden. On each turn, the active player will roll a die and move to the appropriate vegetable as long as it isn't occupied by a fellow player. Some vegetables are occupied by spiders, causing the player to lose a turn, while others are occupied by friendly ladybugs that allow the player to take another free turn immediately.

The first player to reach the final vegetable cart -- by rolling a tomato or carrot -- wins the game.

name: Buzzy Buzzy Beez
description:
This game for very young players serves as an introduction to basic boardgames. Players are bees racing from flower to flower, following caterpillars and butterflies but avoiding spider webs. The first one to reach the "nest" wins!

One of two games (alongside Veggie Land) released by McWiz as "Insecto: The Great Insect Race"

name: McWiz Junior Booster Bus: The Bus of Knowledge in Math
description:
This is an expansion pack for McWiz Junior, though it can be played separately. It consists of math questions geared towards four age categories: 6, 7, 8-9, and 10-12.

Expands:

McWiz Junior
categories: Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Math, Trivia

name: Destination South Africa
description:
A game of taxi driving through South Africa. It's a rather random process of collecting fares, avoiding fines, and other such mishaps, while visiting many of South Africa's tourist destinations.

One of many in the "Destination" series.

name: Destination World Jr.
description: The latest game in Rachel Lowe's "Destination" series, specifically geared towards younger kids and learning the geography of the world.

name: Shaman
description:
From the box top: "'Every journey begins with a single step...' A trivia game about North American Indians. Created and conceived by Canadian Native People. First Edition: Dog Soldier."

Tough trivia game with four players, traveling along a footprint-littered path throughout a North American playing board. Around the edges of the board are cloudy totems and Indian spirit figures.

Spaces on the footpath include "Lament" "No Man's Land" and "Free Throw."

Made by Coup Enterprises of Winnipeg.

name: Fargo-Moorhead Trivia
description: Standard chamber-of-commerce booster game. Roll a die and answer trivia questions about the city of Fargo-Moorhead.

name: The Game of Petaluma
description: Monopoly-styled game promoting the local businesses of Petaluma. In addition to the purchasing of properties and the charging rent to unlucky opponents who trespass, the game features a "Commodity Futures Exchange" where players can "invest" money for potential profit based on chance rolls of the dice.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Per-cento
description: Math bingo game for teaching relationships between fractions, decimals, and percentages.

name: Reddingopoly
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

Standard localized re-theme of Monopoly game play, this one for Redding, WV.

name: The Kingdom
description:
"An exciting and educational board game that makes learning the scriptures fun and easy. Players move along the path racing to be the first to reach The Kingdom by answering trivia questions based on Bible scriptures."

"Incorrect answers lead them to "Bible Study", "The Chapel", or, worse yet, "The Darkness", causing them to lose turns."

name: Pohaku
description: Twenty-four tiles similar to Quadominios except that the colors red, yellow and blue replace the digits. The rule book includes four games and twenty-six puzzles using the tiles.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Resopol
description:
Welcome to the Hotel business. You will be the manager of a couple of hotels in Sweden. Have you what it takes and the skills to be a manager? See your empire grow and be the first to get 5 million and win this game.

Contents:
1 Boardgame
2 dice
6 piccolo pieces
6 plastic top in different colors
128 cards
Green and red hotels
Money
Rules

name: Kamchatka
description:
INTRO
Kamchatka (yes, THAT Kamchatka), somehow, has escaped the damage brought by man’s over development of our globe. To this day it remains one of the great unspoiled wildernesses on the planet and one of the most rugged places on the Earth. Located on the Pacific’s Ring of Fire, Kamchatka holds some of the world’s most beautiful active volcanoes. Add to that the earthquakes, mudslides, flooding, and avalanches and it is easy to see why Kamchatka is literally a force of nature.

The fauna is just as imposing: Giant roc-like eagles reign from above (seriously, google Stellar’s Eagles-these things are unreal!); huge sockeye salmon are plentiful in the many rivers and waterways; walrus and seals live and breed along the shores; herds of reindeer number in the thousands; and there is a greater density of giant grizzly bear in Kamchatka than anywhere else in the world.

GAME
In Kamchatka you must fight to survive. Time stands still here: You play an indigenous hunter hundreds—even thousands—of years ago surrounded by Kamchatka’s frigid seas, great rivers, dense forests, and snowcapped volcanic mountains. Your village depends on you and your small hunting party to hunt, trap, and trade in order to search out the resources they need. You will risk your life on this journey through Kamchatka’s harsh bush and in its treacherous seas to bring back the required resources to your villagers.

Kamchatka is designed to play solitaire or for 2 to 4 players.

name: Don Mattingly's Baseball
description:
A simple roll dice and guess result to score points.

Contents:
1 felt Baseball field
1 bat
3 runner markers (blue)
4 scoring markers (2 white, 2 red)
3 umpire markers (blue)
2 pitching dice
4 hit dice

The batter takes the bat and places it over any three box sections of the batting box. The bat is laid across, up and down or diagonally on the boxes. It should cover 3 squares.
The pitcher roll the two pitching dice to determine where the pitch went.
If the bat is not in the section of the pitch, the batter is out, otherwise the ball is hit and the batter rolls the four hit dice to see what type of hit he has gotten.
A roll of one ball equals a single, two balls are a double, three a triple and four balls are a home run.

The Sport Dice is a collection of sport, there are Basketball, Football, Boxing and Golf.

name: Yhdistä sana ja kuva
description: An educational domino-like game with puzzle-like pieces for children. All pieces include a word and a picture; they can be placed next to each other only if the two match.

name: Kiekko GaMes
description: A Finnish hockey trivia game with questions about the following leagues and tournaments: SM-liiga, I-divisioona, NHL, IHWC, Canada Cup, Olympic Games, women's SM-liiga and hockey rules. By answering questions correctly one can place player cards (with real Finnish player names) to the rink, whereas wrong answers lead to the penalty box.

name: Valencia
description:
This one is my first game design and was a finalist in the Hippodice competition. For those having the desire, time and energy to put it all together, the files are here for print and play. You will need to supply money.

A summary of the idea:

The Game
You have been hired to go to the island of Valencia and acquire crystals before your opponents. You will meet the various personalities that make up the island and must bribe, steal or buy to accomplish your mission. However, others will be attempting to do the same. So, be smart. First you must try to earn the ear of the council person to tell you where the best deal in town can be found. Only the highest bidder will get the location known only to them. Being a smart treasure seeker, you may follow quietly and search the area around where the high bidder goes. Unfortunately for everyone, people only have a limited number of crystals. Once a site has been visited, no one may visit again.

name: Fall nicht vom Hocker
description:
Content:
board, 4 pawns in 4 colors, 1 number die, 1 color die

Each player tries to get opponents to fall off of the stool without falling off of the stool themselves.

name: Bunte Reihe
description:
Content:
tiles with the value 1-6 or different colors, 1 die with numbers, 1 die with colors

The players are landscape planners. They have tiles to get rid of them and to form a landscape with them.

The first player to get rid of his plates wins.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement

name: Bienenkorb
description:
Content: board, 1 die, 4 pawns in 4 colors

The honey bees collect honey in order to bring it to the bee queen. Each of them like to be the fastest.

name: Quiz & Co. Europa
description:
Content: 31 cards with 8 questions and answers each, packed together in a fan

The game can be played with questioning and answering by points. 10 points are the final goal, or it can also be played by time. Who has the most points after a certain time wins.

The "Reise"-Edition (traveling) has questions about the European states.

name: Moon Rocket Express
description: Thrilling adventure among the planets. An educational game designed to provide hours of thrilling entertainment for young astronauts while they become acquainted with this new and exciting race through space.

name: Besser-Esser
description:
From the rules:
Do you know the Taster-lots family? You don't?! No wonder; they come from a very distant planet and they touched down on earth by accident. When they visit a supermarket they are overwhelmed by the tons of food because on their planet there is only pink striped slimy sea grass. So they start tasting everything: cheese, chocolate, butter, plums, frozen pizza,
spinach, potato chips, canned fish, raspberry marmalade…
Suddenly their faces go all funny with squares. “I feel really sick!” moans Tim Taster-lots. “I have eaten so much I can't move”, complains Daddy Taster-lots. They all know they have eaten too much. But what should they have eaten and how? Can you help?

Throughout the game you collect the foodstuff that your body needs during the day. Doing so, you should collect neither too much nor too little foodstuff. The food pyramid printed on your stamp sheet shows how much and which foods you should eat during the day. Each little box of the pyramid corresponds to one portion of the foodstuff shown.
Example: Your body needs 4 portions of fruit and vegetables while you should only eat 1 portion of sweets (a portion is as much as fits in your hand).
The aim of the game is to be the first to have checked all the boxes on your nutritional sheet with a stamp.

name: Uncle Duke's Napoleonette
description: Napoleonic miniature wargaming at 1:50 scale with 15mm miniatures. The smallest command element is a Division, miniatures are organized into Regiments. The rules include orders of battle for the 1809 Austrian campaign.

name: None Shall Pass!: To Arms!
description:
Marlburian army lists for use with "None Shall Pass!" wargame rules.

Includes 19 major armies and 22 minor allies. Also has uniform information and a short bibliography.

Expands:

None Shall Pass! 1688-1717
categories: Age of Reason, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Kaktus
description:
Content: board, 4 x 4 pawns in 4 colors

Bugs surround sheltering the buds which start to bloom. Which bugs are the busiest?

name: Bafel
description: Bafel is a Mastermind variant with a few unique twists. You assign numerical values for five positions, and your opponent can ask for the totals of various positions, until someone can guess all the values.

name: Moorhuhn: Zock um dein Leben!
description:
(Taken from a resale webpage, translated into English)

The well-known "Moorhuhn" computer game turned into a funny dice game. Keep your cool, for the life of the animals depends on the luck of the roll. Caution is advised - if a chicken appears, all points and one of the animals are gone. And every player only has three of them ...

name: Fun With Colors
description:
Parents and teachers created our products to be effective learning tools, which entertain and educate. The "Fun with™" series of products are designed to stimulate the language and learning skills in young children by introducing two languages seamlessly.

Fun with Colors™ identifies primary and secondary colors, shapes and color association involving familiar objects. It is important to identify objects within each color and ask the child to repeat words and identify objects and colors.

English - Spanish - Box set includes: DVD, workbook and game cards.

Ages 3 and up
2 to 4 Players.

name: Fun With Numbers
description:
Parents and teachers created our products to be effective learning tools, which entertain and educate. The "Fun with™" series of products are designed to stimulate the language and learning skills in young children by introducing two languages seamlessly.

Fun with Numbers™ will help a child learn to count from 1-20 in two languages. The product teaches sequencing and associates a corresponding object with that number. Learning sequencing is an important factor in pre-reading skills.

English - Spanish - Box set includes: DVD, workbook and game cards.

Ages 4 and up
2 to 4 players.

name: Da-Di-Do
description:
"A game of fun for Ages 9 and up,
a must for grades three to five."

An educational game where players roll dice and then add and multiply the pips on the dice. The totals are entered into the player's scoring chart. Players try to fill up particular colours to prevent the other player from claiming that colour. The game ends when one player fills their side of the chart. The the winner is the player with the highest total score. Somewhat similar to Yahtzee.

Contents:
4 Dice
Instructions
Pad of scoring charts.

name: Trivial Trivia: Idiot Edition
description:
From the back of the box:
Tired of being called an idiot because the rest of the players seem to know something in every category and you appear to know nothing at all? Then this is your chance to change all of that with Trivial Trivia "The Idiot Edition" Trivial Trivia is so simple, you'll feel like Einstein.

With 6 different categories you can play it by itself or spike other trivia games and give yourself the winning edge. Sit back, relax, and enjoy this new style of trivia. It won't give you a headache, but you might get a side ache from laughing!

Contains 50 blue and white trivia cards in a double deck lidded box.

name: Wonder Garden
description:
From the back of the box:
"This is a most interesting and instructive game. As many children can play as there are cards. Place all of the circular pieces in the center of the table and turn them all face down, then give each player a card. The object of the game is to complete the cards correctly. The first players selects one of the pieces. If it completes a figure in his card this player has another opportunity to draw and continues in this way until he draws a piece which does not belong in his card, which piece is put back on the table face down and mixed in with the others and the next in turn plays in the same way and so on until all have played. Continue playing in turn and the one whose card is complete first wins the game."

Note: Box claims a patent date of July 23, 1912

name: Sentence Builders
description:
Object of the game is to make high score by building a series of sentences with different word requirements. Cards are separated by various parts of speech (color coded. Each player gets a card rack and stores their cards like you would place your scrabble tiles. Instead of making words with letters you make sentences with words.
The game is separated into 6 rounds/ There is different requirements for each round using verbs, nouns, adverbs, conjunction, interjection, adjective etc...
The winner is the player that earned the most points at the end of the sixth round.

name: Professor Quizzle's Quiz Wizard Trivia
description:
This is another game that was created in the early 80's to ride the coat tails of the success of Trivial Pursuit. There is no board, so you have to keep track of your correct answers on the handy included notepad. The trivia questions are on very looking familiar cards, and each card also has a category associated with it - go figure.

The most interesting thing about the game is the cute little cartoon of Professor Quizzle printed on the otherwise plain box.

name: Subway Run
description:
A card game from Korea in which you play a subway inspector. Rules in Korean, but cards seem to be mostly language independent once you learn the meaning of their symbols. Cards are circular.

Comes with 66 route cards, 18 action cards, 1 die, 1 set of instructions, 1 tin circular case. Ages 8 and up.

name: I Win
description: Educational game for teaching elementary math. A player starts by taking a face up card or one from the deck. The player then checks his hand for any matching pairs to form a complete and correct simple arithmetic equation. These pairs are placed face up on the table, and the player then discards one card. The game continues until one player rids his hand of all pairs.

name: Kracht van 8 Kaartspel
description:
The cards in this game show situations from the daily life of young kids. Each card has a short, positive message. With the 42 cards, 8 different games can be played.
By playing these games, the children will learn to treat each other (and themselves) with respect.

name: MoonDragon
description:
MoonDragon is a game consisting of fourteen hand-painted stones. The stones represent two dragons, each consisting of seven parts: a head, two wings and four legs.

Both players control one dragon, and try to chase the other dragon away from the moon. The fight involves taking up complicated stances, which should protect your dragon's vulnerable areas while allow him to bite your opponent's dragon. These stances can get quite complicated, for example: your head between your right wing and a hind leg, while your front legs are over your left wing.

name: Star Wars, A New Hope
description:
“Luke, Han and Leia need to get back to the Millennium Falcon in the Death Star’s Docking Bay. But Vader and his minions are in hot pursuit.”

The game is played on the map from the Escape From the Death Star miniature game, or the players may design a custom map. The object of the game is to destroy all of your opponent’s characters. Each player controls three characters. The Rebel player plays Luke Skywalker, Princess Leia, and Han Solo. The Empire player plays Darth Vader, an anonymous Stormtrooper, and (from the Episode III cutting room floor?) Boba Fett.
Each character has a deck of cards containing a specific number of Power, Toughness, and Force cards in allocations intended to represent the relative abilities of the characters. These cards are used to resolve combat. Movement of the characters is determined by drawing Area cards.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: SanQuest
description:
Subtitel: Een bloedfanatiek spel

A race game were you roll the dice, move and have to answer questions about blood in 4 categories.

Sanquin is a Blood Supply foundation http://www.sanquin.nl/sanquin-eng/sqn_home_eng.nsf

name: Airship Adventures
description:
“Players control fanciful Victorian Airships used to complete various Missions around the Globe. Background: The year is 1850 and Airships rule the Skies! Victory: The first player to accumulate 20 Victory Points is the winner.” Victory Points are lost or gained based on how successfully Missions are completed.

Each player controls an Airship which has six basic traits: Military, Exploration, Diplomacy, Transportation, Rescue, and Speed. Attachment and Crew cards help improve various traits. Each airship starts with five randomly drawn Crew cards and Attachment cards. The Crew cards represent exceptional people aboard the Airship. The Attachment cards represent Weapons, Tools, Rooms, and Equipment built into the Airship.

Components: Three decks of cards (Mission Deck, Crew Deck, and Attachment Deck) and two ten-sided dice.
categories: Adventure, Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Print & Play, Travel

name: Suspect Behavior
description: Suspect Behavior is a free party game by Tim Denee. One player is the inspector and the others are the suspects. Each suspect wrights down who he or she thinks did it and then the investigator questions each suspect until he or she knows who did it.

name: Army Quest
description: A tactical combat rules system for pitting plastic army men against plastic fantasy figures, such as those found in Heroquest (hence the "Quest" name of this game.) The units are rated for hit points, movement allowance, attack range, and hit probability. The player who eliminates all of the opposing pieces wins the game.

name: Asimov's Foundation
description:
“Players take the roles of the first foundation (psychohistorians) and the second foundation (mentalists). They compete for control of the future second galactic empire. Victory: The player who first wins the Second Galactic Empire Phase wins.”

The game is played using a shared custom deck of cards, although certain cards are only usable by one side or the other. The cards represent personalities, objects, and locations from Asimov’s Foundation series.

name: Astral Dreams
description:
A tabletop “Space Opera Miniature Game” based on the designer’s story of the same name.

“It is now the dawn of the five hundredth millennium since the birth of Christ. The Empire of Man has reached out into the intergalactic depths of space, and a lost son has been found…unfortunately. The great Quantumliners of the Scouting Guild has encountered an artificial species completely inimical to humanity. Each alien robot is directly controlled by a single artificial intelligence known as Ladek! The twisted, disembodied mind of the former human scientist now lords over these automaton artifacts of a long extinct race. They have invaded every galaxy controlled by man’s glorious Imperium, and have begun a systematic extermination of every human life it encounters. While the Imperial Navy and Marine Corp defends the home galaxies against the attacks of these monsters, it falls to the Scouting Guild to hunt out and destroy Ladek units along the Imperium’s frontier worlds.”

“One player plays the Human Imperial Scouts and the other plays the Ladek Marine Robots. Forces are ‘purchased’ by means of points. Both sides must decide how many points they should begin with. I highly suggest beginning a campaign (a series of wargames between the same player(s)) with fifty points for each side.” The object of the game is to destroy all the opposing units.

name: Astrum Imperium
description: A game of empire building and conquest in outer space. Each player starts with a home system and ten random units. The players explore space searching for new planets, establish diplomatic relations with inhabited planets, and build colonies to bring in revenue. Revenue is required to maintain fleets and train new leaders. As the empires of the players become more technologically advanced, they gain access to more sophisticated spacecraft and installations.

name: Crack of Doom
description:
“Lord of the Rings Theme. Each player is their own 'Fellowship'. Victory: Players race to see who is the first to destroy the One Ring.”

The game is played on a track 72 spaces long. Designated spaces on the track represent the Shire, Moria, Mordor, Mount Doom, and other Middle Earth locations. Play Foe and Harship Cards on your opponents to hinder their progress. Use Aid Cards to defeat such cards played against you. To win the game, reach the last space on the game track and make a successful die roll to destroy the One Ring.
categories: Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Galax
description:
“Tactical Space Ship Combat Mayhem. Advanced Battleships.”

The game is played on a numbered hex grid. Miniatures or chits, marked for facing, are used to represent the spaceships. The players construct their own fleets based on lists of ships and weapon systems. The scenario sets the number of fleet points that each side starts with. Three scenarios are included in the rules.

Movement and combat are simultaneous, based on simple written orders. Combat occurs from the last space a unit enters. The written combat orders consist of indicating the weapon system fired and the mapsheet grid number being targeted. Damage inflicted depends on defensive equipment of the target ship (fields, screens and jammers) and the type of weapon used. Nukes and missiles caused fixed amounts of damage, while energy and projectile weapons have diminished capacity at longer ranges.

Statistics are given for nine types of base ships, ranging from the lowly Transport (used for scenario victory conditions) to the burly Battlestation. Ships are rated for cost, move, hits, number of shields, and number of weapons. Some types of ships can carry Fighter Squads. Ships can be equipped with three types of shields: Albedo Screens (protect against energy weapons), Intertia Fields (protect against projectile weapons), and Jammers (protect against missiles.) Weapon systems that can be purchased include Lasers, Rail Guns, Missile Launchers, Missiles, and Nuclear Missiles.

name: Gladiator School
description:
“VOW OF THE GLADIATOR: I submit to being burned, chained, beaten, and killed with an iron weapon."

“Supplemental meta-game for Gladius. Players are masters of their own gladiator schools. Buy them, train them, and send them to the arena.”

The players start with 50 gold and one gladiator. Slaves come up for auction and are bid on by the players. The players then match up gladiators to be fought using the Gladius card game rules. Each player involved in the fight receives an award of gold, the amount of which varies based on whether the match was won or lost, and for each of their gladiators that fought animals.

The players must pay a regular upkeep cost for every gladiator owned. Gold may also be spent to enhance the training of gladiators.

Fame Points are awarded to players at the end of each turn based on factors such as owning the most gladiators, having the most gold, and winning matches. The player with the most Fame Points after twenty turns wins the game.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Print & Play

name: Gundam Wing
description:
A miniatures game based on the Mobile Suit Gundam universe.

The game includes statistics for over 50 different Mobile Suits from seven different Factions. In addition, the rules allow you to design your own Mobile Suits.

Eleven different generic Suit classes are defined, each of which is rated for Move Points, Hits, and Size Class (Small, Medium, and Large.) Seven classes of Weapons Systems are provided in the rules, with each being rated for Size, Damage, Range, Ammo, and Cost. The combat rules include hand-to-hand combat and critical hits.
categories: Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Ground War 3000
description:
“Sci-Fi themed board & card game for 2 players. Each figure represents a vehicle, mech, or infantry squad. Victory: You rout the enemy if you destroy 9+ of his units.”

The game is played on a chessboard or any other 8x8 grid. Miniatures or counters are used to represent the combat units. Each side starts with sixteen units: two Mechs, six Vehicles, and eight Infantry.

A custom deck of cards is central to the play of the game. The players draw a hand of cards from a common deck. Card play determines when units may move, attack, or defend. In addition, Obstacle cards may be played in response to movement cards, sometimes casuing the moving unit to sustain damage. Other special cards allow a unit to both move and attack in the same turn.

name: Grognards
description:
“Board & card game for 2 players. Napoleonic warfare theme. Abstract skirmish level combat. Each figure represents a company or unit of men. Victory: You rout the enemy if you destroy 9+ of his units.”

The game is played on a chess board or any other 8x8 grid. Miniatures or counters are used to represent the combat units. Each side starts with sixteen units: eight Infantry, four Cavalry, and four Artillery. A custom deck of cards is central to the play of the game. The players draw a hand of cards from a common deck. Card play determines when units may move, attack, or defend.

Optional rules provide for terrain, which comes in six types: Clear, Deep Water, Forest, Hill, Redoubt, and Marsh. The terrain features impact movement and combat in various ways.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Napoleonic, Print & Play

name: Grenadier Tactics
description: The game is played using two custom decks – an Army Deck and a Battle Deck.
