The game is played on a hex map showing the area around Ming's Palace, which is located at the center of the mapsheet. All of the Imperial units start within two hexes of the palace and the Rebel forces start along the map edges.

The Rebels win if Ming is killed. The Imperials win if all of the Rebel Leaders are killed.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Kill Gwen Stacy
description:
"Card game for 2-4+ players. Gwen Stacy was Peter Parker’s true love. In order to jack up the sales of their funny books Marvel decided it was a good idea to kill her off. Sales did go up, as did fan outrage. Now heres a chance to redo comic book history but with a twist."

The game uses a custom deck of 52 cards. There are five types of cards: Method, Conspiracy, Location, Save, and Fate.

The players attempt to play melds of cards of the same type.
A player who is unable to play a meld on a turn must roll on the Event table and take the specified action. Once you have three melds in play (one each for Method, Conspiracy, and Location), you may make a die roll to see if you kill Gwen Stacy. If the roll is successful you win the game, otherwise you lose some or all of your melds and the game continues.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Print & Play

name: Traveler Traders
description:
"A solo card and dice game of trading in the Imperium."

"In this one player game you play the Captain and crew of the FREE TRADER BEOWULF. The Goal is to profit 73 Mega Credits (i.e., 73,000,000 Credits), which is just enough to buy a SUBSIDIZED LINER and become a Merchant Prince. But in the 1350th year of the GALACTIC EMPIRE, this great Utopian civilization of Humanity is far from civilized. Trading in the Spinward Marches Sector, even close to its ducal capital REGINA, can still be dangerous."

Expansion rules allow the game to continue as a Master Trader with a Subsidized Liner attempting to earn another 73 Mega-Credits to build a Mercantile Principality.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Troopers
description:
"A battle between Futuristic Troops."

Each side has sixteen units: eight Troopers, two Tanks, two Aircraft, two Hovercraft, one Artillery, and one Commander. The object of the game is to kill the opposing Commander.

The game is played on a chessboard or any other 8x8 grid. Miniatures or counters are used to represent the units. A custom deck of cards is central to the play of the game. The players draw hands of cards from the shared deck. Card play determines when units may move, attack, and defend.

name: Pot Leaf The Game
description: Actually a SPIN and Move game. The box says that this game is "The Pot Party Game of Crazy Dares and Hilarious Surprises" The object of the game is to go from the Start to Munchies Land using spin results from a "Do or Dare Spinner". The game box stated that this game is "for fun and is not meant to be played for marijuana. The game pokes fun at those that smoke weed. The game comes with a 12 x 7 game board, a die, a Do a Doobie Dare spinner, 6 game markers and a rule book.

name: All Aboard
description:
From the box: "An educational and fun trivia-type game of railroad facts, history & modeling."

The six knowledge categories on each card are: People and Times, Engineering, Hobos and Slanguage, Railroadiana, Model Railroading and Caboose[appears to be general train knowledge].

Default game is to nine correct answers but the rules mention you can set the endgame to any number you like.

The cards are color coded so they can be used with other trivia-type games [example: you could replace the Trivial Pursuit deck with this deck].

The questions are not easy.

name: SnowCrystals Game
description:
SnowCrystals is a beautiful and challenging pattern game. The game contains 96 diamond shaped tiles with segments from five different snow crystals printed on them. The goal of the game is combine and match the pieces to form completed snow crystals. SnowCrystals is appealing to adults as well as Ages 5 and up.

The snow crystal designs were patterned after the photographs of snowflakes in the historic book SnowCrystals by W.A. Bentley and W.J. Humphreys, Dover Publications - New York, 1962.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Heart Patient
description:
"Each player takes the role of a Heart Patient. Object: Be the patient to live the longest."

The game uses a custom deck of cards consisting of six types: Medical Interventions, Lifestyle Modifications, Surgery, Pathological Events, Drug Therapies, and Heart Attack Cards.

Each player rolls up a character/patient to establish seventeen "risk factors", which include items such as Family History, Cholesterol Levels (LDL, HDL, and Total), Weight, Diabetes, Alcohol, and Smoking.

name: Heavy Metal Mayhem
description:
A card game which takes its theme from the universe of the science-fiction film Heavy Metal.

The game uses a custom deck of cards. There are five types of cards in the deck: Hero (Heroine), Foe, Location, Travel, and Special Cards.

The first player to make five melds wins the game. A meld consists of one Hero/Heroine card, two Foe cards, two Location cards, a Travel card, and a Special card.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Ice Lords
description:
"Wargame for 2 or more players. Fantasy Northern theme. Victory: Destroy all enemy units."

The game is played on a chess board or other 8x8 grid. Map tiles are randomly distributed in the center 49 squares, the border squares being considered sea spaces. The terrain tiles come in eight different types: tundra, glacier, water, villages, forest, mountains, peaks, and hills.

Each player starts with one Hero unit placed on a Village tile. The players must recruit units and build armies. Units that may be recruited include Norsemen, Barbarians, Viking Ships, Northern Dwarves, White Dragons, Frost Giants, Polar Bears, Ice Witches, and Yetis. A deck of Spell Cards is used to determine the capabilities of units that have magical powers. Players can augment their forces with relics (Magic Axe, Druid's Staff, or Banner) which increase the power of certain units.

name: Interzone
description:
"Card game for 2+ players. Based on the novel 'Naked Lunch' by William S. Burroughs. Each player is a 'junkie writer' living in the Interzone. The Interzone is a fantasy underworld city of addiction, intrigue, drugs, monsters, homosexuality, hedonism, control, humor, despair, and violence. Writers compete to be the first to finish their book."

"Game play: Writers convert Junk (drug) cards into pages (of their book). Writers make contacts (Junkies, Doctors, Monsters, etc) that they can use to attack (& defend themselves from) their opponents."

"Victory: The first player to write 213 (or more) pages wins."
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Mature / Adult, Novel-based

name: Knights Templar
description:
"Card game for 2-4 players. Each player is a faction of the Knights Templar. Players try to build the best Legacy for the Templars possible. The game ends when one player has 5 or more Downfall cards, or when there are no more cards in the deck."

The game uses a custom deck composed of nine types of cards: Legacy, Allies, County, Treasures, Mission, Power, Battles, Enemies, and Downfall. Collecting certain types of cards provides Victory Points. The winner is the player with the most Victory Points at the end of the game.

name: Krull Quest
description:
"Board & Dice game for 2 players. Based on the Fantasy Film Krull. One player is the Good Prince Colwyn. The other player is the Evil Beast in his teleporting Black Fortress."

The game is played on a circular track divided into thirty-two spaces. Every fourth square is a Village. Each player has one pawn. The Colwyn player's pawn represents Prince Colwyn and his Companions, numbering ten men at start. The Beast player's pawn represents the Beast in the Black Fortress.

The Beast wins by razing all eight Villages or by killing the Prince. The Prince wins by locating the Black Fortress, killing the Beast, and saving Princess Lyssa.
categories: Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Lunar Conquest
description:
"Sci-Fi Themed Card game. Lunar Warfare between 3 main Factions."

"The Lunarians live underground and were not even aware of the Humans presence. Likewise the Humans did not know about the Lunarians. When the Silexians arrived, in a single colony ship, they immediately detected and Proceeded to Attack the colonies of both other races. All sides have been openly hostile to each other in the ensuing confusion & carnage."

The Lunarians start with six Bases each having a Force value of six, the Humans with four Bases each having a Force value of four, and the Silexians with two Bases each having a Force value of five. Each player uses a unique deck of Unit, Event, and Modifier cards which are used to launch attacks and to defend Bases.

The object of the game is to eliminate all of the enemy Bases.

name: Stampede!
description:
Play six different card games while learning unique horse facts and vocabulary from each card.

Build a corral of cards before the mustangs escape in the solitaire game Stop the Stampede! Make rows of cards using higher and lower numbers in Rising Trot. Win cards to spell HORSE in Have You Herd? Collect sets of cards in Roundup and Colorful Horses, but avoid the lone mustang in Old Mare.

This versatile card deck also includes four bonus collectible horse breed cards.

name: The Original Preppie Game
description: Preppy Life. Roll and move your way to getting schooled, getting drunk, getting privilege, and getting a trust fund from Mummy and Daddy.

name: Castle Construction
description: The game is played on a castle's foundation (a square grid) where players place their pieces of different colors, trying to get the largest groupings of their color together. As they play, players also lay walls and doors, as well as "room tiles", which determine the shape and size of each room in the castle.

name: Estate Playing Cards
description: This is an Australian 62-card deck with 5 suits of 12 cards. The suits are Waves (green), Hearts (red), Diamonds (yellow), Clubs (blue), and Spades (black). Each suit contains 12 cards - Ace, Woman, Man, 10, 9, 8, 7, 6, 5, 4, 3, and 2. The jokers have been replaced by a Pope and a President card. The deck comes with a leaflet that has rules for the games of Waves (aka Black Pete), Estate Bridge, 600, Pusoy Dos, Poker, Canasta, and Euchre. It can easily be used to play other card games like Solitaire, Snap, Crazy 8s and Rummy.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking

name: Mine Eyes Have Seen the Glory
description:
From the DG website:

Mine Eyes Have Seen the Glory (NEW), aka Glory, has been moved back to new status due to an exciting development. The designer has added two new elements to the game that will make this a truly unique ACW game. First, he is adding Manifest Destiny, a Mexican-American War mini-game that will serve as an introductory scenario. This short campaign will give new players an excellent place to start playing and veteran players will have a game that can be finished in an evening. The second element is Crisis & Compromise, a card play oriented game of the period from the end of the Mexican-American War to the start of the Civil War. Though little combat occurs (guerrilla warfare in Kansas, etc.), the card play covers the actions inspiring events, leaders and regional positions (Border States) that affect the allegiance of states to a region and the ability of military leaders at the start of the Civil War. Crisis & Compromise can be played alone or used to create alternative starting situations for Glory.

Glory is a grand strategy game of the American Civil War in the style of Krieg! Maps of the Eastern and Western Theaters include terrain, Strategic Objectives, roads/rail, naval zones, navigable and non-navigable rivers, cities and locales, supply centers and other features affecting the game. Counters represent the corps and armies of the war. Cards provide the strategic-political-economic direction for each side. Strategies are many and varied but the ultimate goal is to demoralize the opposing faction's population through military, economic and political victories while sustaining your own population's will to continue the fight. The players each choose a Strategy Card and an Addendum Card before each new season and may opt to play an additional card as a diplomatic response to certain events. These cards lead to new military units, leaders, and replacement steps and result in socio-economic and political events. The events include the declaration of Emancipation, the elections of 1862 and 1864, and the possible intervention by European nations. Events are often double-edged swords, sometimes providing a military advantage while negatively affecting the popular will to fight. In addition, both sides may attempt to develop and manufacture new technologies, both historical and speculative, such as ironclads, submarines, torpedoes, observation balloons, repeating rifles and Gatling guns. Both sides can introduce espionage and even sabotage, which can have many unexpected consequences, including assassination. Three maps, 352 large counters for Glory and 280 small counters for Manifest Destiny and Crisis & Compromise, 220 cards.
categories: American Civil War, American West, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hexagon Grid

name: Clubhouse: the tee to green golf game
description: Players play their way through the Druid's Forest golf course using 3 coloured dice to determine the results of each golf shot. Distance is determined by a book of "Club Cards" showing the results of each die combination for each club chosen. The game is played on 2 large boards showing the 2 halves of the course. Scorecards and player markers are included.

name: Slick-Tac-Toe
description:
In Slick-Tac-Toe players try to get three pieces in a row, but they can be any three pieces.

On a turn a player may make two moves; one move must be one of their own pieces, but the other can be any piece. Players move their own pieces forward or backward and the opposing pieces sideways. A piece always moves until it hits another piece or the edge of the board.

When a player achieves a scoring configuration they forfeit their second move if not already made, and the game resets. The first player to score three times wins.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Pattern Building

name: The Moon Mullins Game
description:
The MOON MULLINS Game based on the comic strip of the same name. The comedic things that happen in the cartoon strip happen in this game from "Bumping in to a Fat Lady" which causes you to move back 2 spaces to "Tripping over Carpets" which results in your being able to advance 3 spaces. This is a simple roll and move game from the late 1930's.

Components for 1927 ed:
16.25 x 16.5" non-character specific game board
5 die-cut thin cardboard full-color character playing pieces
4-1/8 x 4-1/8" separate spinner with large image of "Kayo!"
set of character playing cards

name: Happy Camper
description:
Happy Camper was inspired by John Conway's Game of Life. It can be played on any flat surface using any objects that can be arranged in a square grid.

The game is played in two phase. In the first phase players start "campsites" with one "camper" (piece) each and then take turns adding one camper to their site and one to their opponent's. When all the campers have been used the second phase starts; the last player takes just one camper and places it in the opposing campsite. (The number of campers is odd; the rules suggest 11, 13, 15, or 17.)

In the second phase players take turns removing a camper from their opponent's campsite and placing it in their own. The removed piece must have fewer than two or more than three neighbors, and must be placed in a space with exactly three neighbors.

When neither player can move the game ends and the player with the high score wins. Three scoring variants are given: in the simplest each camper is worth one point, in the others the pieces have to have numbers on them (e.g. playing cards) which determine their point values. The numbered pieces can be used face-up or face-down, with players only able to look at them when they are moved.

name: E-GADS
description:
E-GADS was developed by Bob Slater to raise funds for humanitarian projects around the world.

Contestants move around the game board collecting cards and attempting to slow down the progress of the other players. When a player lands on a "War" space a special die roll settles the conflict using the classic rock/paper/scissors method!

Includes a colorful game board, tokens, dice, score sheets, cards, instructions, and storage insert.

(c)2002 Core Club International
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sons Of Hercules
description:
Based on a syndicated television show from the 1960s. The show itself was a repacking of a number of Italian sword-and-sandal epics, most of which had nothing to do with Hercules.

There are six events shown on the game board, but they have noting to do with the mechanics. Players roll two dice and by using the number on each die, or the sum, try to cover one of the six spaces on the board. The player that covers the last spot receives an award ring. Players can also challenge an opponent for their rings. First player with four award rings wins.

Milton Bradley number is 4632.
categories: Ancient, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Mythology

name: Video Grin 'N' Bear It
description:
Video Grin 'N' Bear It is a game designed by Bizarre Games and Spitting Image.
The game includes a 60 minute VHS video, hosted by Hysterical Eddie, a puppet created by Spitting Image.
Before playing the game 6 props from around the home are selected. Each prop is labeled 1 to 6, to correspond with the spots on the huge game die.
Each player then also receives 6 laughter tokens.
The tape issued various challenges and players lose their tokens for doing something wrong.
The last player remaining with tokens is the winner.
There are also variations for play included with the games rules.
categories: Dice, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: A Man Called Mr. President
description: Players attempt to guess the United States President that appears on the bottom of a card, based on clues on the top of the card.

name: Kiss & Cry: Women's Figure Skating Game
description:
Features All skaters who appeared in at least 2 competitions during the 2005-2006 season are included

Each skater rated in 7 different categories, from technical elements to deductions.

Separate .pdf files for each country allow for easy competition setup. Run any event from a single country exhibition to an Olympic final. Both short and long programs available.

Optional scoring modifiers and homer judges rules

Keep score on the scoresheet as you play; a calculator is required to figure the total scores.

name: Blackbeard's Last Stand
description:
Blackbeard's Last Stand is a fast-paced, stacking tile game for 2 players. Players pick 5 tiles from the pouch and then take turns stacking the different tiles in sequence. Be the last to stack the Blackbeard tile, win the Doubloon and plunder your opponent's points to win the round. Be the first player to score 100 points to win Blackbeard's Last Stand!

Contents of Blackbeard's Last Stand Game Tin:

* 1 Replica Doubloon
* 10 Wooden Plank Tiles
* 1 Cloth Pouch
* Instructions and Hightlights of Blackbeard's Life, Death and Travels.

name: Heroes & Hordes II
description:
A solo card game pitting the player's heroic bands of men, elves, and dwarves against evil hordes of monsters. The game culminates in a climactic battle which the heroes must win to prevail.

The game uses a custom deck containing approximately 120 cards. There are four types of cards: Heroes (forces of the men, elves, or dwarves), Hordes (forces of the goblins, undead, and dragons), Traits, and Events. The Heroes fight in three groups segregated by race. The Evil Hordes also fight in separate groups until all cards have been drawn from the deck, at which point the remaining Hordes form into a single unit which the Heroes must destroy to win.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play

name: Remember the Alamo
description:
"Simulates the siege of the Alamo in 1836. Card game (no dice required). For 1 (Solo) or 2 players. The Texians and Mexicans have their own unique decks."

This card game is playable solo (with the player as the besieged "Texians") or with two players. You win when your opponent goes to draw a card and there are no cards left in his deck.
categories: American West, Card Game, Fighting, Print & Play

name: Portland-Cityopoly
description: "An entrepreneurial business and trading game". Monopoly clone for the city of Portland, OR, where one builds not houses and hotels, but "branch offices" and "skyscrapers".

name: Salem's All-American Street Game
description:
Satiric simulation of navigating the "driver's nightmare" streets of downtown Salem, OR.

"Object of the game is to travel downtown Salem, accomplish your errands, and be the first player to return home."
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Wicce Hearts
description:
A witchcraft themed card game.

The game is played using a custom deck of 36 cards. The deck is divided into four suits (Ankh, Pentagram, Familiar, and Item) numbered 1 to 9. The players attempt to win each turn by playing the highest ranking card from the same suit as the first card played on the turn. The winner of the turn receives all cards played on the turn.

The game is won by the player who scores the most points. Points are generally based on the value of the Pentagram cards held by your opponents. In addition, bonus points are awarded for holding certain cards or combinations of cards.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Print & Play, Religious

name: Play by Play
description: This fascinating game is designed to play along with a TV or radio broadcast game. Contestants join in the action by trying to predict each play before it happens. The points awarded for each play are determined by their degree of probability.
mechanics: Action Points, Commodity Speculation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Troll Trouble
description:
"The dark order of wizards have been bickering over who has the most gifted house elf. They have decided to organize a contest and send their naughty little house elves into an old mine to retrieve the magical golden egg of Eddenburg. The 1st elf to return to the Mine Entrance with the golden egg wins."

"The hen that lays the golden eggs is protected by a giant and his body guards (a family of rock-hard ugly trolls). The giant and his bodyguards have been living in this same little mine shaft for over 300 years. Now as you can imagine the mine is really disgusting, there are germs everywhere, and not only germs but super germs. These super germs can cause diarrhea in house elves. As you can imagine it is hard for an elf to ride in the mine carts and sneak around quietly without their Pepto Bismo."

"As far as combat the trolls certainly have an advantage over the elves in strength, but they are stupid and sometimes completely forget who they are and what they are. They begin to waddle and walk around in circles mumbling to themselves. If these trolls had a brain they would be really dangerous."

"Another interesting aspect of trolls is that when they see an elf they drool, and when I say drool I really mean drool. Because of this it is really difficult for an elf to sneak around because they are tracking mucus around on the bottoms of their boots, not to mention it is really slippery. On the positive side when a troll captures a house elf and drools all over it, it can become very slippery and sometimes
it can squirm and slip free."

"Two other techniques house elves have learned that are effective against trolls. First, trolls can't stand elves that squeak and second, trolls are particularly self conscious when elves flash them."

name: The Horde
description:
A card game based on the vintage Crystal Dynamics fantasy computer game of the same name. The game is played with two custom decks, a Recruit Deck and a Horde Deck. The Horde Deck is composed of Hordlings, the creatures that make up the Horde. The Recruit Deck includes forces which the player will use to combat the Hordlings.

The takes on the role of Chauncey, who must hold off the Horde for five years, battling the Hordlings in a predetermined series of locations, including the Shimto Plains, Fetid Swamps of Buuzal, Tree Realm of Alburga, Kar-Nyar Desert, and Frozen Wastes of Vesh.

"Victory: You (Chauncey) are killed if all 4 Grimthwacker cards are in the Recruit Discard Pile. You lose if you are ever unable to play your taxes. You win if you survive all 5 years (=20 turns)."
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Pow-Wow-Opoly
description:
This is a culture-based variant of Monopoly. The game has an Aboriginal powwow theme, allowing players to learn a bit about the culture as they play.

From the game's website "My vision of this game is that it educates the general public and inquiring minds about what a Pow-Wow is and how it is an expression of our culture as First Nations People. It has also been my vision to see our culture in a format that is fun and accessible to all people, to share the little idiosyncrasies that make us “Indian”. After playing Pow-Wow-Opoly you will know what an Indian Taco is or that we always carry a little duct tape in our “Indian Car” for quick repair jobs on our travels; we usually have a spare blanket in the trunk and an extra hand drum just in case."

The website is www.pow-wow-opoly.com
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: El juego de la Luna
description:
A very simple roll-and-move game. Players roll a die and move their playing pieces through the board spaces, in some of which there is a humanized Moon in one of their phases (full, new, first quarter and last quarter). Depending on which phase of the Moon the players fall, they stay where they are, advance additional spaces or go back to previous spaces.

Note: The current info on the game is scarce and not fully accurate, as it dates from 1890. If anyone has additional information and more accurate data, please provide it.

name: Gates
description:
A connection game played on a triangular board made up of hexagonal cells. The object is connect the three sides of the board by a continuous path. Pieces are hexagonal tiles that contain both players' colors. Players alternate turns, placing a tile in one of three possible orientations on a board hexagon.

The game now comes in several different rule-set flavors, including one called "Hex Gate" in which, as in Hex, players try to connect their own sides of the board with a continuous path of their own color

name: Rift Rats
description:
Rift Rats is the nickname given to an elite group of Starliner Captains who navigate rifts in the space-time continuum delivering prospectors to landing zones throughout the galaxy (d’ers dilithium in d’em d’er planets). In an effort to deter future prospectors, tribes of native species from these planets have built a defensive network inside the rifts known as the Rat Trap. How good of a starship pilot are you? Think you can survive the 'Rat Trap'?"

The designer notes: "Many solo games offer a very limited course of actions, require very little thought or strategy and are overly dependent on luck. Rift Rats attempts to challenge solo players and provide a variety of different situations."

A solo or multi-player game. The object is to deliver seven passenger pods to seven landing zones, or to be the first to do so in a multi-player game.

name: Police Pursuit
description:
Police Pursuit is a law enforcement question and answer game with three levels of play. Players with greater knowledge of the criminal justice system will be challenged by the more complicated questions.

The "good guys" and the "bad guys" move along two tracks while avoiding five color-coded category traps:

TV-Movies Cops & Robbers

History Of Crime & Gangsters

Jurisdiction & Crime Trends

Police Technology

Case Law & Courts

Includes a colorful board, hundreds of question cards, tokens, dice, rules, and a storage insert.

Ages 14 and up.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game, Track Movement

name: The Big Umbrella Game
description:
The rules are short enough to post here, so here they are directly from the game box.

OBJECT: To be the first player to move from Start to Finish.

PLAY: Each player decides whether he wants to be a duck or a cat. The first player places his playing piece on the starting space for ducks, if he has a duck, or on the starting space for cats, if he has a cat. He then spins the big umbrella and moves his playing piece counterclockwise to the next space of the color indicated on the spinner.

Cats can only move to spaces under umbrellas and ducks can only move to the rainy spaces. For example, if a player who has a cat playing piece spins red, he can move forward, in this turn, only if the next red space is under an umbrella. If it is not, he cannot move at all and must wait until his next turn.

Play passes to the left, and players advance whenever they spin the color of a space to which they are allowed to move. Whenever a player spins the color that matches the color on his playing piece, he may spin again. A player must spin the correct color to land on Finish.

The first player to reach Finish is the Winner.

name: Duel Blade
description:
Duel Blade pits two combatants of equivalent skill in a contest of strategy and endurance. Choice of armor and weapons helps to shape combat strategy and fighting style. Weapons balance attributes of accuracy and power, armor balances the attributes of evasion and deflection. Are you a powerful barbarian brandishing a mighty battle axe, or a swash buckling pirate who finds value in speed over strength? Choice of armor and weapon will change your strategies and your game.

Available for download from http://www.1km1kt.net/cat/tabletop

name: Zoom! in on French
description: A French vocabulary building game, where one player chooses one of the 400 tiles, reads the word, without showing the players the picture on the other side, and everyone searches for an illustration of the item on their personal game board. Once found the tile is placed on the grid containing the item.

name: Innervision
description:
From the Back of the Box:

Increase your awareness with the challenge of Innervision

A unique and exciting new board game that tests your knowledge with 4,800 questions and answers in six separate categories: Entertainment, Art/Literature, Culture/Geography, Black History, Recreation/Sports, Nature/Science. Sharpen your wits--learn about the history and culture of black people and their many accomplishments and contributions.


This game appears to be a Trivial Pursuit-like game but with a different board layout as well as score-keeping pieces. My set was without instructions but it could be playable with standard Trivial Pursuit rules.

name: Yucky Stuff card game
description:
WARNING!
May not be appropriate for people with weak stomachs.

Yucky Stuff Card Game:

This is a deck of 30 cards by Discovery Kids that was given out at Arby's with the kids meal. There are 5 categories: Strange & Ugly (Blue), Beetles & Bugs (Green), Amazing Body (Yellow), Body Bugs (Red), and, Dirty Devils (Purple). Each card has an item featured on it. Most of them are creatures like slugs or stink bugs (Hence Yucky Stuff). Some are body parts like fingernails or the stomach. Each card has great artwork and facts. This game is played like Go Fish.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Educational, Memory, Real-time
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Ripley's Believe It or Not! Did You Know? Quiz Cards
description:
Prepare to be amazed as you quiz your friends, family, and even yourself. These quiz card facts are stranger than fiction, yet each one is absolutely true. The deck includes 200 extraordinary facts, in four categories: Amazing creatures of the land and sea, Science, Inventions, and Technology. Fascinating people through history facts from around the world. Astound yourself. Astonish you family and friends. Learn some unbelievable-but true facts.

3 different games to play:

Choices (2 Players)

Risk (3 or more players)

Dream Team (4 or more players in teams of 2)

name: JUMP
description: Essentially, the objective of the game is to be the first player/team in a race to move all game pieces around the track and into a home path, while impeding the progress of the opposing players/team through strategic interference. Players move around the board, using cards dealt to them. Cards are clearly marked with alternate uses, increasing the available play options. A key component is that play pieces can be coupled, allowing the top player to take control of his opponent’s play piece(s). Other forms of interaction include trading, uncoupling, switching control, and sending an opponent back to start again.

name: Recall Comedy
description:
The Video Observation Game.

Players divide into teams.
Players watch a short video clip and are then asked a series of ten questions about what they have just seen and heard.

From Back Of Box - "The observation game based on 20 humorous clips with 160 question cards. The clips are so funny you will forget to remember the details! So simple it's fun for all ages and any number of people!!"

name: Russo-German War
description:
"Board & card game for 2 players. WWII East Front very abstract simulation. Each figure (unit) represents an army or armored division. One player is the Germans, the other is the Russians (Soviets). Victory: Destroy all opposing units."

The game is played on a chessboard or any other 8x8 grid. Miniatures or counters are used to represent the units. The German player has eight units (three Armor and five Infantry) and the Russian player has sixteen (four Armor and twelve Infantry.)

A custom deck of cards is central to the play of the game. The players draw hands of cards from a common deck. Card play determines when units may move, attack, and defend.

Optional rules provide for an alternate German victory (the capture of Moscow) and Summer/Winter Offensive effects.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, World War II

name: Silly Sounds
description: Educational game for teaching children consonants by having them use alliteration to form adjective/noun word pairs.

name: Militia Groups
description:
"Each player controls a militia group in a region undergoing civil war. Victory: Reduce your opponent to zero population tokens. Each player starts the game with 20 population tokens. (Members of their own ethnic group)"

The game uses a custom deck of card composed of three card types: Leaders, Units, and Events. The Unit cards are used to attack and defend, but Leaders are required for Units to be used for offensive purposes.

name: Mobopoly
description:
"Multi-player board, card and dice game. Each player is a Mob Boss trying to make money and rub out his rivals. As the head of a Crime Family you recruit Capos and Enforcers to do the dirty work and then you take your cut."

"Object: The Mob boss with the most money when the last card is drawn from the Wiseguy deck wins."

name: Moskito Coast
description:
"Players are Drug Traffickers smuggling cocaine shipments from Columbia into the US. Victory: The first player to accumulate $50,000,000 wins."

The game is played on a single track that is thirty spaces long, representing the journey from Columbia to the United States. Each player receives three pawns representing Trucks, Planes, and Boats. There are also three pawns (land, air, sea) for the US forces and three pawns for Central American forces.

Money is earned by getting pawns to the United States space at the end of the board. If a player's pawn lands on a government pawn, it is considered captured and must be removed from the game.

name: Napoleonic Solitaire
description:
"Solitaire card game. Unique Deck. Something to pass the time for the casual Grognard."

The game uses a custom deck of forty-two cards in four suits: Light Infantry, Line Infantry, Cavalry, and Artillery. Each suit has ten cards rated with Strength values from 1 to 10. In addition, there are two General cards.

The deck is randomly divided into two halves, each with one General and twenty other cards. One half-deck is the Allies, the other is the Enemy.

The game lasts for fie turns. After the fifth turn, the player's score is determined by counting the number of Enemy cards captured.

name: Ring War
description:
"Two player card game simulating the struggle between the forces of good and evil in Tolkein’s The Hobbit and The Lord of the Rings."

"There are two decks. One player uses the Forces of Light Deck. The other player uses the Dark Powers Deck. Each player starts with 5 Quest tokens and 5 War tokens."

"Victory: The first player to have 10 Quest tokens or 10 War tokens wins. If at the end of a turn one player has 10 Quest tokens and the other Player has 10 War tokens the player with the 10 Quest tokens wins."
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Novel-based, Print & Play

name: Attrition: Pork Chop Hill
description:
"Two player Card game simulating the stagnant Warfare
of the Korean War's later phase." Adapted from the World War I card game Attrition.

The U.S. player begins the game with 50 squads and the Chinese player with 100 squads. The players alternate completing a sequence of five phases: Logistics (draw one card), Artillery Barrage (eliminate a random number of enemy squads - with the U.S. having more effective artillery), Charge Orders (the players may choose to charge, or such orders may be received by the Chinese player), Defender Fire Phase, and Trench Fighting Phase. Certain cards may be played to provide bonuses in some phases.

The U.S. player must eliminate the Chinese infantry and hold the hill. The goal Chinese player is to capture Pork Chop Hill by capturing all six of the territory markers from the U.S. player.

A solo-play suggestion is included.
categories: Card Game, Korean War, Print & Play

name: Paper Kessen
description:
"Card Game for 2 players. Based on the video game Kessen: Three Kingdoms Style Chinese Heroic Fantasy Warfare."

The game uses four different decks: Good Leader Deck (for the Good player), Evil Leader deck (for the Evil player), Recruit Deck, and Action Deck. The latter two are used by both players. Each turn the cards from the players' hands battle.

The first player to win three battles in three consecutive turns is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Video Game Theme

name: Norseopoly
description:
"Board game for 2-6+ players. Each player represents a tribe a of Vikings."

The game is played on a circular track divided into forty spaces. The spaces are marked to designate different locations or geographical areas, such as Iceland, Greenland, Ireland, Monasteries, Normandy, Mediterranean, Novgorod, and Byzantium. These spaces are grouped into eight Regions: Scandinavia, North, Isles, Brits, Francia, Rus, East, and Trade.

As the players move around the board, they raid the locations in the regions and seek to establish settlements. A player who establishes settlements on all three spaces for a Region is considered to have a Kingdom in that Region. Each turn a player earns gold from settlements and Kingdoms under the player's control.

The first player to accumulate 100 Gold wins.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Roll / Spin and Move

name: A Night at the Chill
description:
As the box proudly proclaims: "It's Not Your Common Game!"
This game was a promotional item for the Columbus Chill of the East Coast Hockey League.

Intro from the rules:
"Your group of three Chill Fans are at the Chill game. They were so excited to get to the Coliseum that they rushed out of the house and forgot to eat dinner. Object of the game is to move your three Chill fans from the start section of their color around the arena - through the FOOD STAND, to get all of their food cards, to the SOUVENIR STAND to get all of their souvenirs and get up to their proper seats before anyone else. At the same time, there's a hockey game going on!"
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Jump Volley
description: Jump Volley is a large-format dexterity game by Eliott Games. Players use an elastic launcher to throw balls into their opponent's play area. The first player or team to remove all balls from their play area wins!

name: Tik: The Ultimate Card Game
description: Tik: The Ultimate Card Game, is played like rummy, and scored like cribbage. A game similar to progressive rummy scored on a hardwood board reminiscent of a cribbage board. Player attempt to make melds of cards so as to move from the starting place on the board to the finish line, any losing points count against you and you move away from the line.

name: Maxi Tam
description: Maxi Tam is a fast-paced, large-format dexterity game manufactured by Eliott Games. Players use small wooden paddles to strike a wooden ball into their opponents' goals. The playing field is made of stretched cloth.

name: Go Foot
description: Go Foot is another large-format dexterity game sold by Eliott Games. Players use U-shaped wooden strikers to flick a wooden ball into their opponents' goal and defend their goals.

name: Pass Ferme
description: Pass Ferme is a large-format dexterity game by Eliott Games. Players use mallets to manipulate specially-shaped discs. The first player to rid his playing area of all discs is the winner.

name: Farben ringsum
description:
The meadow is scattered with multicolored blooms consisting of hexagons. Square black & white cards with simple pictures are next to the board. The active player turns over a meadow tile - and sees a multicolored butterfly! Your job is to see if you can make the butterfly wings fit the image on the b&w card - if you can, you get the card... and if you can't, you pick up the meadow tile. You win by getting the most cards.

If younger players (the game is rated "Ages 3 and up" have trouble playing with the rules as written, you can easily adapt the game by removing some of the cards.

-- paraphrased from a Babel-ation of the Spiel des Jahres site description

http://spieldesjahres.kiratec.eu/cms/front_content.php?idcat...;id=529

name: Take Siding
description:
Players take turns traveling around the spaces of the game board, each designated as a mile post along a train track. The player executes the action of the mile post they land on.

If the mile post contains a switch, the player must roll a die to determine if he or she must continue along the main line or take siding, which has its own spaces for movement before rejoining the main line.

The goal of the game is to be the last player to reach a fixed number of demerits, or brownies, assigned throughout the game.

Individual spaces may assign brownies; require the player to draw message or job insurance cards, which immediately go into effect; lose a turn; transfer some of your brownies to another player; or go on vacation.

Landing on another player sends them to the Extra Board, where they roll for some benefit and to determine where they must re-enter the main line.

name: My Brain Hurts
description:
A new, twisted game from Jolly Games. There are only blank cards in this game. You get to make up your own cards. After everyone writes up 3 cards, the cards are shuffled and dealt. Take turns playing the cards which are even allowed to change the rules of the game!

Similar to:

1000 Blank White Cards

name: Talking Traffic
description:
Talking Traffic enables children to learn how different question forms are used in an enjoyable game play situation. The activities provide a supportive environment in which to help children develop confidence and practice in vital listening and communication skills.

Talking Traffic cards also may be used as an assessment tool for a range of visual discrimination skills including colour, size, shape and number.

name: Nebraska Trade 'em
description: This game was played at SAZ-Party on 09-02-2008 first time at the Nuremberg Toy Fair. Only 50 copies of special poker card decks were printed. Each Player gets 3 pocket cards and can trade them with the other players to create the best poker hand. Each Player is allowed to choose 5 cards from his own three pocket cards and 5 community cards, which are available for all players. The more players take part, the more poker decks will be needed (approximately 1 deck per 17 players and one deck for community cards).

name: Tam Foot
description: Tam Foot is the smaller version of Maxi Tam by Eliott Games. Players are equipped with wooden paddles that are used to defend their goal and to strike a wooden ball in an attempt to score on their opponents. The player to score the most goals wins.

name: Tibi
description: Tibi is a large-format dexterity game produced by Eliott Games. The aim of the game is to be the first team to propel all your balls into your opponent's goal. Players are equipped with unique ramps which are used to launch a cue ball.

name: Twin Flip
description: Twin Flip is a large-format dexterity game produced by Eliott Games that borrows heavily from pinball. Each player simultaneously mans a set of flippers and defends a goal on their side of the board. The winner is the player who scores the most goals and hits the most targets. Additionally, the game may be split into two sections for individual play!

name: Bone-Didley
description: Bone-Didley is an exciting game involving both skill and luck. As long as you keep scoring you can keep rolling...But, you risk it all with each new roll! So, have fun but don't get caught with Bone-Didley!!

name: Pound Puppies The Card Game
description:
From the box:
"These highly successful and irresistibly cuddly dogs have captured the hearts and affections of thousands of children and adults with their doleful expressions, floppy ears and huggable qualities.
Shaped to be hugged, the Pound Puppies' motto says simply:
"All I need is love".
Join these lovable bundles of fun in this simple card game where the winner is the player who has collected all the cards at the end of the game."

Game contains 40 giant sized play cards and rules.
For Ages 5 - 11.

A simple game of trick taking.

name: Germania
description:
Germania broadly represents the situation in western Europe following the fall of the Roman Empire. Each of two to five players represents one of the Germanic invaders who, pushed by the Asiatic Huns, settled in and eventually destroyed Rome. As they attempt to consolidate and expand their holdings, a variety of invading nations threaten to overwhelm them, as they overwhelmed Rome. The game combines “Euro” elements with a light historical wargame. The game uses no dice; players use cards to influence combat, and also use event cards to control non-Germanic invaders and influence other players. Scoring occurs each century, with the last century counting much more than others.

In some ways this is a game of survival, of maintaining a civilization. It is possible to win without directly attacking other players, though successful players usually directly attack another player at some point in the game.

Players take turns executing a variety of Actions up to a limit of six Action Points. Some of the Actions are creating new settlers, moving pieces, and playing Event Cards. Three or (in Standard and Advanced games) four rounds of turns are a century. Invasions occur at the end of each Century, or they may occur because of an Event Card played by a player. One player or another temporarily controls Invaders as they invade. Players attempt to increase the number of settled areas, improve those areas, and, in Standard and Advanced games, build cities. They will probably fight Invaders, and may fight one another, using Battle Cards to help resolve these fights.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Lite'n Up: The Diet Survival Game
description: A light-hearted roll and move board game that pits players against the "wheel of willpower." Beware of "Restaurant Row." Comes with a 20 x 20 board, 8 player pieces, 80 tokens, calorie cards, a spinner, 2 dice, and more.

name: Panzer Korps: Campaigns – Rules & Scenarios
description:
This supplement adds a variety of campaigns for the Panzer Korps operation scale WW II rules, though the order of battle and maps are sufficiently detailed that they could be used for other games if desired. Twenty scenarios spanning the West Front, East Front, North Africa, and Pacific theaters from 1935 through 1944. Each scenario includes forces and maps for the first battle of the campaign. Additional battles in the campaign are based on the results of the previous battle(s). For example, if the offense breaks through the defense in one battle, the next battle may be fought with the defender employing a delaying action with hasty defenses.

Typical table sizes are 6'x4', although table sizes up to 12' are used for larger campaigns.

Expands:

Panzer Korps: Divisional Level Warfare 1936-1945
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Phase Order

name: Ta-Se
description:
This is light game where each player has 8 chips ranging from 1 to 8. There are 3 cups. Each player takes a turn placing this chips in the cups. Whoever wins the most cups wins the round. There a few scoring twists involved.

Get the full game rules from: http://www.gamecabinet.com/rules/TaSe.html

name: TALK.BIZARRE, The Board Game
description:
The "T.B, the Board Game" duplicates all the action of a typical month of talk.bizarre! From the creative postings of most respected oldbie, to the hapless struggling of the most mediocre cavenewt, and yes, even down to the pathetic mewlings of the rankest newbie--you will be there! You will cringe from the heat of the flamewars and the razor sharp wit of the repartee! You will experience the thrill of posting great articles, the shame of posting pathetic articles, and the surge of triumph as you show no mercy, pushing your fellow players over the brink of the volcano... (from the website)

Full Rules from: http://www.gamecabinet.com/rules/TalkBizarre.html

name: Kasvoton vihollinen
description:
Kasvoton vihollinen (Faceless enemy in English) is a game for 2 players. Kasvoton vihollinen is a combat game where two armies fight using cards that were drafted partly at random in the beginning of the game. Cards are placed on the board as initial setup and they can move on the board in a somewhat chess like manner.

Rules contain variants to play the game with 4 players as teams and tournament rules.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Greedy Billionaires
description:
Players attempt to accumulate interlocking groups of corporations that feed off one another so as to avoid paying money to anyone else.

It is a roll and move with a twist. When a player lands on his own property, income is collected. When a player lands on another's property that property pays expenses to other industries. Properties can be developed to increase their income and traded among players.

At the end some of the properties are nationalized and players add up their property and cash value. The richest billionaire wins!

name: A Tank Battle Game
description:
During his work at the Operations Research Office, the physicist George Gamow invented a simple war game to be played by analysts. The game is played with three identical boards, one for each of the players and one for a referee.
The board … represents a tank battlefield by a lattice of hexagons, … some of which are hatched to represent wooded areas of low visibility. The white hexagons represent open fields, and the size of a hexagon represents the “radius of action” of a tank in battle.
Each player starts with ten markers representing tanks at his back line, and “a move” consists in displacing any number of tanks into any of the adjacent hexagons. Each player sees his board only and must infer from the play where his opponent’s tanks are located.
(from the rules)

Get the full game: https://grognard.com/download/games/board/tankgame.pdf

name: American Eagle
description: This game consists of 48 cards with questions and answers on them. Start by dealing the cards in equal amounts to all players. The first player starts by asking a question from one of his cards of the player on his left. If that player answers correctly, he gets to take the card and set it aside. If he answers incorrectly, the questioner gets to take a card from that player's hand and set it to his side. If the question is answered incorrectly, the questioner gets to continue to ask other players, until all players have been asked, or the question is answered correctly. If no player gets it, the questioner gets to set that card aside. After all cards are exhausted, the player with the most cards laid aside wins.

name: Digi-Quate
description: Digi-Quate is a game invented by a lecturer from the National University of Singapore. Players draw 10 tokens or tiles with numbers or mathematical operators on them and try to form equations on a square grid playing board. Subsequent play intersects with already played tiles, crossword-style. Covering special squares on the board gives bonus points.

name: Higher Digi-Quate
description:
Higher Digi-Quate is an advanced version of Digi-Quate. Like Digi-Quate, it was invented by a National University of Singapore lecturer and it is game of forming mathematical equations on a square grid board. Players have hands of 10 tokens showing numbers and mathematical operators. Each turn they try to form an equation, intersecting crossword-style with equations already on the board. Covering special squares on the board gives bonus points.
The feature that distinguishes Higher Digi-Quate from Digi-Quate is that it adds three dice to the game, a green D10 (numbered 0 to 9) and two red D6s (numbered 0 to 4). The board is larger and there are now bonus squares with pictures of a green D10, a red D6 and two red D6s. Placing an equation that covers these dice bonus squares allows the player to roll the dice and their score may be multiplied; there's also a small risk that the score may be multiplied by zero.

Digi-Quate is a game invented by a lecturer from the National University of Singapore. Players draw 10 tokens or tiles with numbers or mathematical operators on them and try to form equations on a square grid playing board. Subsequent play intersects with already played tiles, crossword-style. Covering special squares on the board gives bonus points.

name: Aviation
description: This is one of the first card games featuring aviation modes of transport. The deck consists of 67 cards. 46 of them represent types of air transportation (balloon, biplane, etc). the other 21 are "consequence" cards.

name: Bourse
description:
There are 56 cards in the deck, and the theme is that of trading world currency. The number of cards used to play varies with the number of players. Game requires at least 3 but may be played with up to 7. The cards include 48 "Capital" cards. 8 each from London, New York, Montreal, Paris, Brussels and Berlin. There are also 7 "rise and fall" cards and 1 "sell" card.

The goal of the game is to make a profit at the "Close of the Market" on whatever currency they hold, which is represented by the "Capital" cards in their hand.

name: The Bride
description: A card game dedicated to Princess Alexandria of Denmark, who married Edward VII of Wales in 1863 at Windsor. The game consists of 48 cards with color pictures of wildflowers. It looks like a set collecting card game.

name: Tee Party
description:
From the box:

A golf game on the 19th hole for golf widows, hackers, and experts.

The game comes with 4 pawns, 8 stroke counters, 64 cards, and 5 different hole layouts.

name: Preums !
description:
Preums! is a free card game for 3-6 players. Everyone plays as a blogger, trying to build the more valuable blog in order to sell it. The game is quick and fast : most actions are played simultaneously. The card are drawn by webcomics artists, the game is available or free on the Internet.

Aim of the game

You have to meet around your blog the most valuable visitors. After that you can raise founds. Be the first one to have a "six zero worth" weblog.

Home Page: http://preums.webcomics.fr/page/sets-de-cartes-premi%C3%A8re...
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Electronic, Humor
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: El Quinielín
description: Sports lottery using the traditional betting system of the Spanish football league. Can be played alone or between several players. A wheel is used to obtain the results. A familiar game from the 50's in Spain.

name: Olive Oyl: I'll Catch My Popeye
description: Actually this is a SPIN & MOVE game from Hasbro dated 1956. The game comes with a large Spinner that has numbers from 0 to 4 which determines your movement. The game also has a board with around 50 spaces of differing colors which allow Olive, equipped with her trusty rolling pin to attempt to catch Popeye. The game comes with two playing pieces, one for Olive and one for Popeye.

name: Naked!
description: From the manufacturer: Naked! has the same values and suits as a regular poker deck, but printed on each card is an article of clothing. Play your favorite poker games. When you win, you get to assign cards from your winning hand to other players. Players who receive cards have to remove the clothing that is pictured on the card. The winner is the last player remaining who is not Naked!
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Le tri sélectif
description:
The goal of this game is to score a maximum of points by playing cards representing recyclable and non recyclable wastes.
A recyclable waste is composed of two cards, and hence is worth two points.
A non recyclable waste is only represented by a single card, and is therefore only worth one point.
This is an educational game which aims at helping to distinguish recyclables wastes from non recyclable ones.

name: Sauve Qui Peut
description:
From 1790 to 1815 Europe was at war with itself and dragged most of the rest of the world with it. The Napoleonic Wars are Earth’s first true World War. England and France had colonies all around the planet. Many of the other nations entered the fray. Most note worthy was the War of 1812, the USA v Great Britain.

SQP is a chance for players to take one of the armies of the
combatants into one of the large battles that denoted combat for that period. Experienced players can easily maneuver 40 or more battalions. The rules are historical and designed for a medium degree of difficulty. Veteran gamers will feel comfortable after a walk through. Players new to gaming will be able to compete after their first game.

SQP is designed for two to six players to enjoy a three hour game.

Armies list for the 17 major European nation, the Ottomans and
Americans are included.

name: Trail Blaze
description:
Trail Blaze contains burning questions, high stakes and pot luck. Reactions may include intense rivalry, feelings of euphoria, and an increased awareness of cannabis and it's effect on your health and liberty. Trail Blaze may leave you with a clear head that persists for days, months or even years. However, taking too many risks can lead to unpleasant side effects.

Players take it in turns to roll the dice and move their counter the corresponding number of squares in the direction of the arrows.

If you land on a question square someone else must read you a question card. If you answer correctly, go forwards to the next green square. Get it wrong and go back to the last red square.

If you land on a risk square, take a risk card and follow the instructions. Return cards to the bottom of the pack.

The winner is the first player to get home.

name: Suomirokkia trivia: Lisäkysymykset 2007
description:
200 new question cards for Suomirokkia trivia. Also includes Genius-questions for the "real sages".

Expands:

Suomirokkia trivia
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Music, Party Game, Trivia

name: Fraction Games
description: This game comes with pieces of a circular pie in halves, quarters, thirds, eighths, and sixths. The basic game is to complete a playing mat in as few rolls as possible. There are 5 playing mats that show a full pie in each of the evenly distributed pie shapes (e.g. all 4 quarters). The game is intended to be educational mostly.

name: Sports Pursual
description: A board game in which the object of the game is to gain the most money after 3 laps of the board are completed by dice throwing, questions and gambling of money in hand.

name: Bajo el Sol de África
description:
Spanish skirmish game for the period of the Africa exploration between 1830 (conquest of Argel by the French) and 1925 (end of the Rif war).
The rules not only allows for historical scenarios, but also to introduce more "fantastic" elements as Tarzan, Allan Quartemain etc, or set it into a more "steam-punk" Victorian setting.
The first edition is out-of-print but there is a 2nd one published in 2008
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Bajo el Sol de África: El Libro de los Ejércitos
description:
Armies list for the Spanish skirmish game "Bajo el Sol de África".
It covers both the European nations (as regular armies and local-trained troops) and the African tribes and local warlords that waged during most of the XIX century in the Dark Continent.
Included Arae Anglo-Egypcians, Askari, colonial expeditions, Arabs and Swahilis, Azande, Majdist, Masais, Zulus,...

Expands:

Bajo el Sol de África
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Zoodyssey
description:
From the box:

"Zoodyssey is the only family board game that combines the fun and excitement of going to the zoo with scientific understanding of some of the world's most endangered animals.

The game takes about 55 minutes. Players move along the paths of the zoo and collect Animal Snapshot cards. Each card has a picture of a zoo animal, some Fun Facts about that animal, and a point value. The more endangered the animal, the higher the point value.

The object of the game is to be the first player with 50 points worth of Snapshot cards.

Of course it's never as easy as it sounds. A rhino may stop you. A toucan may steal one of your photos. Or you may run out of film. But nothing will stop you in your quest to add snapshots to your collection.

In the process, of course, you will come to a greater understanding of some of he magnificent creatures that share our planet. And when it is over, you'll want to set-up and play again."

name: Night of the Slasher
description:
"Tonight the citizens of Hope County are being stalked by a merciless Slasher who will not stop until they have claimed enough victims to satisfy their sick thirst for death!

It seems that the Slasher is someone well known in the community... could it be the high school jock, the nurse, the convict, the geek or even the TV Anchorwoman?"

In this Print and Play game, each player takes on the identity of one of the 12 possible victims. One player will secretly play as the Slasher and has 8 rounds to kill all of the characters controlled by the other players.

The rest of the players must find clues to reveal the Slasher’s true identity or use weapons and other tricks to help them stay alive.

3 to 12 players can play this exciting game of strategy and suspense. Players will need to provide a 10 sided die.

This game has Adult Themes.

Night of the Slasher, the Print and Play game, can be purchased from http://www.wargamedownloads.com/item.php?item=712&;pics
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Print & Play

name: Slink'em
description:
A "3-in-1" board game to be played with a Slinky.

The games are played on a board that folds into a ramp. The players take turns sending the Slinky down the ramp trying to land on the best squares marked on the scoring field. All squares touched are added to the score. There game came with three different boards: "Numbers Game", "Baseball Game", and "Big Game Hunt."

The board for the Numbers Game has squares marked with positive and negative numbers. The center square is normally worth 10 points. However, if the Slinky ends up in "standing position" in the center square and not touching any other square, 50 points are scored.

The Baseball and Big Game Hunt boards are marked according to their themes.

The rules folder offers a bounty of $25 for anyone offering a suggestion for the improvement of the game that is accepted and used.

name: Sexy Slang's Naughty Charades
description:
This is the smaller "charades only" version of the adult party game Sexy Slang. This version of Charades contains Sexy Slang terms.

The new game is marketed as the perfect inexpensive and unique gift for bachelorette parties and new brides.

The game is packaged in a small metal box and contains two card decks, 300 naughty charade terms, a naughty charades die, and a set of instructions.
categories: Deduction, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Word Game

name: Pandarama
description:
In this panda-themed game, players move along black and white squares of a game board, drawing cards with panda facts and movement directions.

This game was created by 9 year-old Amanda Wilcox along with twin sister Laura and their mother Melynda. They started working on the game when Amanda was only about eight years old. Proceeds of the game go to Washington DC's Smithsonian National Zoological Park Giant Panda Conservation Fund.

name: The Road to Health
description:
This educational game shows students the way to better health and physical fitness. As players move their playing pieces around the board, they are asked questions to quiz them on six categories: safety, alcohol and other drug abuse, fitness, mental health and anger management, hygiene, and nutrition.

The game comes a 20-inch wide square board, game pieces, 120 question cards and (including 12 blank cards for adding new questions), and an instructor's guide that contains rules, variations, discussion starters, a die, and a set of reproducible worksheets utilizing all of the game's questions.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Play Rethink
description:
This drawing game with an ecological twist. The players are to rethink existing, everyday products and attempt to make them more environmentally friendly. For example, a player might attempt to redesign a piece of furniture using locally sourced materials or might attempt to come up with new functions for an old piece of equipment.

The game itself is also eco-friendly. It is made in the United Kingdom using recycled and other special types of paper and vegetable-based inks along with eco-friendly laminates and other environmentally-friendly processes.

name: Beat the Market
description:
From the inside of the box (game description of the rules):

"This is a stock market game for 3 to 6 persons. It is played with 4 loaded (8-sided) dice called Quotes which are designed to give the effect of a constantly changing market. The black Quotes are weighted so they usually come up with low numbers and the whole Quotes are weighted so they usually come up with high numbers. Only 2 Quotes are used at a time so that a market can be low (both black), mixed (a black and a white), or high (both white). Object if ge game is to buy stock at a low price, hold it for awhile, and sell it at a higher price. The game ends when one player doubles his money or when someone goes broke. Winner is the player who first doubles his money or the player with the most money when someone goes broke. Each game lasts about an hour."

name: Shellz
description:
From the publisher's website:

The tricky quest for shiny seashells

Compete against other players in search for the most valuable seashells. Build a path that leads to the longest rows of shells to get massive points. Use your branches and curves, build over other cards to cut-off the others path. With the right card you can even dig-out other cards. Place your pawn wisely to get double score. If you manage to connect to paths together, you may even get the other player's score. With three cards on hand you can plan your path carefully, but still the other players may manipulate your path. Also take care not to concentrate on certain kinds of shells only, since the lower scored-shells also count at the end. The war goes off at the middle of the gameboard, it's getting crowded there! Will you stay cool?

Shellz is a tricky building-game. You sometimes have to "think around the corner". Don't let the beautiful shells distract you - it's a tough game for big brains.

For 2 to 4 players Ages 10 and up, 30 - 45 minutes playing time. English instructions included.

name: Maternal Generations
description:
(from the rulebook) Maternal Generations is a quick 2 player card game of strategy. Compete against an opponent to build up maternal "family lines" while considering the best moment to disprove your opposing lines.

Genealogy family lines are built as the player uses the research ability of cards in their hand to get cards from the "gene pool" on the table. Then the player plays one card from their hand to their family line each turn, by placing a higher number card each turn. When you are unable to play on existing family lines, they must start new ones, but only lines of 4 or more cards will score points. Be careful to build lines that score enough points and are safe against the other player's disprove action.

The game contains 34 ancestor cards, 1 wild records search card, and a color illustrated manual.
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: Pilzsuchen
description: A vintage children's race track game about searching for mushrooms. The instructions are in German. The game is played on a colorful gameboard with a fairy tale style fantasy painting of little people among a variety of mushrooms (both edible and poisonous varieties) that are growing in a forest. The game board has numbered points corresponding to the different mushrooms and characters on the game board. A set of cardboard markers are used in the game.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Fantasy, Racing

name: Barons to Kings
description:
Barons to Kings is a tile laying game where players build roads to gain movement and capture markets to earn needed funds. Players build fleets and walls to protect their property while trying to avoid other players and the plague. Battle takes place with cards and dice.
Each player picks a flag on one of the 4 corners of the game board. This spot will be their starting point for every move they make. Gold tile pieces represent various coinage of the age. Gold tiles are the only way to buy new Military, Road & Wall pieces from the center pile which you will need to survive. The only way to get more gold is to get a military unit to one of the Market Squares in the middle of the board & hold it.
Once your empire is built, you will expand towards the other players and begin to conquer.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Adventure, Civilization, Economic, Fighting, Medieval, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Hexagon Grid, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: MAreenz
description:
This is a mech warrior type game with 3 kinds of warriors and a number of enemy units to kill. You can have missions in this one to go grab stuff. This game is a free PnP game where you have your Mech Bots go out and try to get things against the enemy. Includes simple counters for the military, 4 hex maps and a template to create your own bots.

Full Game: http://www.cruzan.info/pgames/pgames.html

name: La Bataille de la Bouteille, Champagne 1915
description:
A wargame covering the French offensive in the Champagne during World War I, from February 16 to March 7, 1915.

Scale is one hex = 500 m, one turn = 2 days, units are regiments.

The French player moves first, then the German. Both players' turns are divided in phases: Movement/Entrenchment, Artillery, and Attack/Advance.

Eight pages of rules cover entrenching, zones of control, enfilade fire and artillery. The historical notes are another 11 pages, including a bibliography.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War I

name: GEO
description: GEO - An abstract strategy game where you place your 18 pieces on the board to make shapes to score points. Free download from http://www.printgames.net/english/detail_e/geo.htm
categories: Abstract Strategy, Print & Play, Territory Building

name: Lex-O-Grams
description:
Subtitled with: "5 Games of Words and Letters"

CONTENTS: The square 'box' that is ONE-inch deep by 7-inches along each side; 374 letters; and "Instructions" sheet.

The 5 Games, as detailed from the "Instructions", consist of the following:

"Anagrams": for 2 to 6 Players with the LETTERS face down, or unseen, when chosen from the pile and used to form 'words' of 3 or more from this. Before PLAY commences, then an agreed upon TOTAL of 'words' needed to Win is determined, and this continues until that amount were accomplished by someone.

"Letter Mix-up": for 2 or more players with all of the LETTERS shown face-up within easy reach for everyone during this, where an agreed upon number to form 'words' is determined before commencing PLAY, are selected by everyone, of which they must try to form a 'word' from those they've chosen. Play continues until ONLY (1) Player can form any 'word' from theirs, while the others are already having had to drop OUT from being unable to do this.

"Anagram Sentences": for 2 to 6 Players and based upon the previous "Anagrams" GAME, with forming sentences for this, and having the same 'Victory' conditions.

"The Game ADD or O-U-T": for 2 to 6 Players with the 1st Player having to select a 'word' of not less than 4 LETTERS while also NOT disclosing what that were, and ONLY placing the first LETTER beginning for their 'word' with what they've chosen. This goes on with the others putting theirs to make or add on to continue a 'word' until someone no longer can, and then they are forced out, with the LAST player remaining becoming the winner.

"Crossword Anagrams": for 2 to 6 Players with being very similar to "Scrabble" for the overall layout, while also for in this game, then all of the LETTERS are kept face-down when being selected from the pile. Everyone then chooses 15 LETTERS unseen to start off with, yet they can look at those in order to make some 'word' for placement, using portions of others already formed, or as for the entire 1st 'word' to begin the GAME with. Once they've done that, or conducted a "Discard", the Player has to "Draw" a single LETTER from either the face-up "Discard" pile (when that is created), or the others of the face-down ones, while PLAY continues until (1) Player uses all of theirs up.

name: Hanga-Tanga
description:
Here's a light strategy game that gives everyone a chance. These first rules require twenty-eight dice - fourteen in two different colors. I really like playing it with dice, but there's a variation described below that will easily allow players to play using as few as one die if necessary.

Also, you'll need an 8x8 checker board.

The object of Hanga-Tanga is to score the most points by arranging your dice in "lines".
(from website)

Full Game: http://www.gamecabinet.com/rules/HangaTanga.html

name: How Not To Be Seen
description:
Players try not to be seen. They must occasionally risk being seen in order to obtain points, but risk certain death if they are seen.

Conflict is resolved by dice rolling. Players use cards of any type to represent their hidden people. It can be optionally played using poker chips. Dice can have any number of sides as long as each player has a matching set.

Based (very) loosely on the Monty Python sketch of the same name.

name: Shootout
description: The all American western family game. For 2 to 4 players Ages 6 and up. Comes with a beautiful full-color board, spinner, two decks of cards, two standees (gunfighter's women) and sixteen plastic gunfighter figures.

name: Warp Away
description:
Just a plain Space Conquest Game. Simple counters show different ship types. Includes a 2 page space map.
Free from: http://www.cruzan.info/pgames/pgames.html
categories: Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Mini Volgrama
description:
The game for the whole family based on the Spanish TV contest from the 60's. It is similar to Crosswords.

Content:

- 1 Board
- 1 Volgrama
- 6 patterns for letters
- 179 game pieces
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: Wrestle Wars: Adventures in the Squared Circle
description:
The ultimate objective of a Wrestle Wars character is to win the Global Super-Heavyweight Championship Belt by beating his or her opponents in one-on-one competition.

Before you begin to play Wrestle Wars you will need the following items: paper, pencils, two or more ten sided dice (d10), and at least one other player. That's it. Now you're ready to create your very own Wrestle Wars wrestler and start playing. (from site)

You create your character by rolling dice for different attributes. You have five randomly determined Character Stats: Height, Weight, Speed, Build, and Crowd Appeal.

To fight, you have to spend your points to perform different maneuvers based on your class.

name: Starts and Ends
description:
Basically, the game consists of listing words related to a topic. Each word must either START or END in a key letter. Look at the graphic below to make this clear. You'll notice that every line has at least one shaded circle. A letter written in those shaded circles are the key letters for the word to be written in the next line. If a word passes through two shaded circles, then the player has a choice as to which letter he or she uses as the key letter for the next word.
(from website)

Full Game: http://www.gamecabinet.com/rules/StartsAndEnds.html

name: Target Practice
description: Target Practice is a fast game of throwing cards at the other player's line to score points. It provides an interesting change of pace in an evening of heavy duty strategy games. For 2 players.

name: Fan Craze
description:
An antique baseball game. The wooden board displays a simple baseball diamond with holes at each base where pegs could be inserted to represent the base runners. The board also has holes for tracking the number of balls, strikes, runs and outs in an inning. The scores for each inning are recorded by writing them on the score card.
